name: The Fool
meaningUpright: new beginnings, leap of faith, spontaneity, curiosity, fresh start, trust
meaningReversed: recklessness, avoidance, naivety, poor planning, fear of change, carelessness
description: An opening door and a fresh wind at your back. This card invites a leap of faith into a new chapter where curiosity matters more than certainty. Go light, stay present, and learn as you go—just keep enough awareness to avoid preventable mistakes.

meaningsUpright.love: The Fool in love is exciting and spontaneous but a little bit fickle. For those in relationships, The Fool shows being so in love you can hardly contain your excitement.
meaningsUpright.health: The Fool bodes well for physical health if you have been ill as it shows vitality and energy. However, it can also indicate being accident prone so if you get the Fool for health be extra careful.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: Opportunity knocks! With the Fool in your career, it may be time to go for that new job or start your own business that you’ve been dreaming of.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The Fool shows that you are at the beginning of a new spiritual journey which will lead on to great things. you be eager to try many different approaches, allow yourself to do this.

meaningsReversed.love: The Fool reversed in love can show that your pursuit of adventure may be holding you back from having the kind love you really want or causing uncertainty in your current relationship. If The Fool is reversed, your relationship may be exciting but may involve some risky behaviour.
meaningsReversed.health: When The Fool reversed is in a health reading it shows trying out alternative treatments could be helpful in resolving any health issues. Also the tendency to be accident prone is stronger when this is in your reading so be mindful of your surroundings.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Fool reversed shows some potentially promising financial opportunities but exercise caution and do your homework before committing to anything. You don’t want to be taken advantage of.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Fool reversed is a sign that you are seeking new spiritual experiences and are eager to cast off your old traditions. Like the upright meaning, people around you might be somewhat puzzled by this new interest.

descriptionReversed: As with the upright meaning, The Fool reversed signifies a new beginning. However, when reversed this Major Arcana trump card shows that the beginning is something you may be reluctant to jump into. This new beginning is still coming either way!

name: The Magician
meaningUpright: manifestation, skill, focus, resourcefulness, initiative, communication
meaningReversed: manipulation, misdirection, scattered energy, underused talent, shortcuts, self-doubt
description: You have the tools, the talent, and the timing to make something real. Focus turns possibility into momentum: intention, attention, then action. Use your skills with integrity and you can move from idea to outcome quickly.

meaningsUpright.love: The Magician in the context of a love Tarot reading is a positive card. For those in relationships, The Magician Tarot signifies the relationship moving to new and deeper level where you can expect stronger commitment and happiness.
meaningsUpright.health: Your strength and good health may be making a comeback if you have been ill recently or feeling drained. If your illness or ill health is not improving you may benefit from trying alternative therapies.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: In terms of money and career, The Magician Tarot points to a new opportunities presenting themselves. They will require you to make a brave move and to put your original ideas into practice.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The Magician Tarot card in the context of spirituality shows that now is a good time to begin some form of spiritual development. If you’ve had an interest in a spiritual subject but never made the time to pursue it, you would do well to concentrate on this pursuit in the near future as your ability to channel magical energy will be increasing dramatically.

meaningsReversed.love: The Magician reversed in the context of a love Tarot reading for those in relationships, can show that you need to be more open and honest with your partner about your needs and desires. If you are tempted to try and manipulate your partner to get what you want, don’t.
meaningsReversed.health: The Magician Tarot card reversed is still generally a positive card indicating that you need to believe in your ability to heal in order to manifest that healing. However, for mental health issues involving any sort of hallucinations, psychosis or paranoia, The Magician reversed shows that you should seek the help of an experienced professional sooner rather than later.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: In terms of money and career, The Magician Tarot reversed suggests that you are not using the skills and abilities you have to make the best of the opportunities available to you. Again you may be experiencing feelings of self-doubt.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The Magician Tarot card reversed in the context of spirituality shows that your old spiritual path may not be suitable for you anymore. Now may be the time to explore a new spiritual path and clear out any old belief systems or practices that no longer work for you.

descriptionReversed: When The Magician reversed Tarot card appears in a Tarot reading it is a sign that you need to be mindful not to miss the opportunities coming your way. Don’t allow self-doubt to stop you from seizing the moment. If it refers to a person, The Magician reversed can mean that a person in your life who presents themselves as knowledgeable and trustworthy may actually be trying to use you or manipulate you.

name: The High Priestess
meaningUpright: intuition, inner knowing, mystery, patience, subconscious, discernment
meaningReversed: ignored intuition, secrets, confusion, emotional noise, overthinking, misread signals
description: Not everything is meant to be decided with logic today. Quiet observation reveals what’s hidden—motives, patterns, and timing. Trust your inner knowing and allow space for the full story to surface.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are a man, The High Priestess appearing in your reading in a love Tarot context usually signifies you become infatuated with an attractive feminine sensual person who may be unattainable to you. If you are a female, she shows that you be highly-desired by more than one person.
meaningsUpright.health: This tarot card is generally telling you to listen to the messages your body is trying to send you about what it needs. The High Priestess can show that you are not being taken seriously in relation to your health concerns.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: In a work context, The High Priestess can show that you may soon become aware of information or an opportunity that will be of benefit to you. The High Priestess Tarot card is an indicator of creativity and inspiration for those involved in the arts.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The High Priestess Tarot card is a card of spirituality and wisdom. When it appears it is a good time to connect with your inner voice and intuition and to trust your higher power.

meaningsReversed.love: With the High Priestess reversed Tarot in a love context, you still find yourself highly-desired by others but you may question their motives or the attention may make you feel uncomfortable. If you are in a relationship, you can expect uncontrolled emotional outbursts and high sexual tension.
meaningsReversed.health: If you have been isolating yourself from the world, you would do well to get active. This reversed card can show menstruation issues for women, hormonal imbalances and/or fertility issues.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The High Priestess reversed can show that you have not been kept in the loop in work. You may be feeling isolated and detached as a result.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: When The High Priestess reversed appears in a spirituality context you may feel like you have lost your normally strong connection to your spiritual side. The messages are still there you just need to take the time to relax and tune into what spirit is telling you.

descriptionReversed: As with the upright meaning, The High Priestess reversed in a tarot reading shows your intuition is trying to guide you and your instincts are correct. However, in the reversed position this Major Arcana card shows that you are not hearing it. You may be more focused on the opinions of others or winning other people’s approval than your own inner wisdom.

name: The Empress
meaningUpright: nurturing, abundance, creativity, sensuality, growth, comfort
meaningReversed: depletion, insecurity, overgiving, creative block, neglect, imbalance
description: This is fertile ground—what you nurture grows. Abundance here is practical: consistent care, patience, and embodied presence. Let yourself receive support and enjoy the beauty you’re building.

meaningsUpright.love: The Empress Tarot in a love Tarot reading is a very positive card to get. If you are single, get ready to mingle because The Empress shows that real love and romance is on the way.
meaningsUpright.health: The Empress is a strong pregnancy indicator and very good omen of success for those actively trying to get pregnant. On the flip side, if you are not intending to get pregnant and you are capable of getting pregnant, The Empress is a warning to be very careful and take proper precautions!
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: When The Empress appears in a Tarot reading, you be feeling very creative and will inspire the people around you with your passion. you be full of new ideas.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: When The Empress appears in a tarot reading in a spiritual context, it shows that your intuition is telling you something and you need to slow down and take the time to listen to it. You instincts will be on point and it’s a good time to start or continue down a spiritual path as you find it easy to connect to your higher power and everything will flow nicely for you.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are single, The Empress reversed can show that you have many potential partners pursuing you but you may not necessarily be putting out to the world the person you really are. Don’t try to be someone you’re not, just to gain other people’s approval especially when it comes to romantic relationships.
meaningsReversed.health: Generally in health terms, The Empress tells you to take care of your health in a productive way as you deal with your emotions. It can show that emotional conflicts may be causing laziness, apathy, lethargy, or binge eating.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Empress reversed can show that you are finding your work unfulfilling or monotonous and long to do something where you feel creatively inspired. You may feel unappreciated in your work.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The Empress reversed appears in a Tarot reading in a spiritual context, it shows that you have disconnected from your intuition which is having a knock on effect in the other aspects of your life. You need to reconnect with spirit it is the missing link to help you out of your current slump.

descriptionReversed: When The Empress reversed appears in a Tarot reading, it again tells you to embrace your feminine qualities. This applies to men too. We are all a mixture of masculine and feminine qualities.

name: The Emperor
meaningUpright: structure, authority, discipline, stability, protection, leadership
meaningReversed: control issues, rigidity, power struggle, chaos, stubbornness, lack of boundaries
description: Structure creates freedom: define roles, rules, and priorities. Leadership here is steadiness, accountability, and protection. Build what lasts by doing the boring essentials well.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single and interested in men, The Emperor in a love Tarot context can show a romantic relationship with an older man. He will like structure, order, logic and routine.
meaningsUpright.health: The Emperor in a health context can mean that you may be being too hard on yourself. Reduce or eliminate activities that are too harsh on your body, avoid punishing exercise regimes and be kind to yourself.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Emperor in a career context shows that your hard work will be noticed and you reap the rewards of status and success. Concentration, focus and perseverance will get you where you want to go.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The Emperor Tarot in a spirituality context can show that you are neglecting the spiritual part of yourself for the more physical/material side. Make time for spiritual pursuits and try not to let the logical rational part of your mind take over and stop you from exploring your sensitive side.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, The Emperor Tarot card reversed in a love Tarot reading can show an imbalance of power in the relationship which is causing conflict or unhappiness. It can signify one partner controlling the other, being possessive, stubborn or overbearing.
meaningsReversed.health: The Emperor reversed shows that you may be being too rigid with your routine and causing yourself undue stress. This may be manifesting in physical symptoms like headaches or poor sleeping patterns.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: In a career contact, The Emperor reversed shows a lack of consistency, focus and organisation leading to problems at work. If you are finding the restrictions work imposes on you are really starting to bother you, it may be time for a change.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: When The Emperor appears reversed in relation to spirituality, it can show wanting to explore alternative spiritual paths. While it is good to allow yourself to explore these paths, it is important that if you come into contact with new spiritual advisors, you still remember to still think for yourself and only take in what works for you.

descriptionReversed: The Emperor in reverse as a person signifies an older man or person in authority in your life who may be abusing his power or being too authoritarian leaving you feeling powerless or rebellious. This person may actually be trying to give you solid guidance but the message is lost due to their domineering behaviour. The best way to handle this person is to remain calm and logical.

name: The Hierophant
meaningUpright: tradition, mentorship, values, community, education, commitment
meaningReversed: nonconformity, questioning rules, new path, value clash, unorthodox, inner authority
description: Tradition, mentorship, and shared values offer stability. Learn from what has worked before—teachers, institutions, or structured study. Commit to a path long enough to master it.

meaningsUpright.love: For those in relationships, The Hierophant is the marriage and commitment card of the Major Arcana. You can expect your relationship to become more committed and begin moving towards new relationship milestones when it appears.
meaningsUpright.health: If you are experiencing health issues The Hierophant Tarot card shows that conventional medicine may be the best route for you at the moment. You would also do well to introduce some sort of health routine such into your daily life e.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: This is a good time to get involved in group or team projects career wise. You should do what’s expected of you and avoid unconventional methods at work and you be successful.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The Hierophant is a very spiritual card, he is known as the link between mankind and the Higher Power. A spiritual advisor might be coming into your life to guide you on your spiritual path.

meaningsReversed.love: The Hierophant reversed in a love Tarot context may signify an unconventional relationship or the desire for one if you are single. You may be breaking with tradition by choosing not to marry.
meaningsReversed.health: If you are ill, The Hierophant in reverse shows that now is a good time to try alternative or holistic therapies. It will benefit you greatly.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: When the Hierophant reversed appears in a career context, it can be a sign of a boss or person in a position of authority being a stickler for the rules and forcing others to conform to their way of doing things. You may have to tow-the-line with this person if they outrank you but you not be happy about it and your work environment will feel restrictive.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The Hierophant reversed tarot card in spiritual context can be a sign that you need to let go of traditional beliefs that no longer serve you. Explore different spiritual paths and find what works for you.

descriptionReversed: When The Hierophant Tarot appears reversed it is time to break with convention. you want to change traditional structure, social norms and rigid rules. Those close to you may not understand this need to challenge the established way of doing things and may be completely against it but with this Major Arcana card appearing you feel compelled to think for yourself and throw away the rule book.

name: The Lovers
meaningUpright: union, choice, alignment, attraction, values, partnership
meaningReversed: misalignment, indecision, temptation, dishonesty, conflict, mixed priorities
description: Choice and alignment are central: what you choose reveals your values. This card can signal union, but it also asks for integrity—head, heart, and actions in harmony. Choose what strengthens trust and self-respect.

meaningsUpright.love: In a love or relationship Tarot reading The Lovers is one of the best cards you can get! It is a soulmate card and signifies kindred spirits and an intense bond between two people.
meaningsUpright.health: The Lovers in a health reading is a signifier that having the right support will help you to get through any health issues. This may be a partner or friend who is offering moral support or a doctor or healthcare provider.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: When The Lovers card appears in a career context, it can represent a business partnership between two people. If it is representing a partnership, it will be a great partnership and mutually beneficial.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: When The Lovers Tarot card in a spiritual context, you be beginning to find harmony within yourself. As with the general meaning, this comes from gaining a deeper understanding of yourself, who you are and your personal morale code.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, The Lovers reversed can show that while the sexual aspect of things is still great, you and your partner may not be on the same page in other important areas. It can also be a signifier that one partner is more emotionally invested in the relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: The Lovers Tarot card in a reversed position shows that you need to reconnect with how your body is feeling to bring harmony and health. At the moment, you may feel like your body is working against you but you need to learn to be kind to it and work within your energy levels.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Lovers Tarot reversed in a career context can show disharmony in a business partnership. If you have a business partner you need to communicate with them and ensure that you are both in agreement about the direction the business is taking and your goals for the future.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Lovers reversed can be an indicator that you have been focusing on materialistic pursuits to try and bring fulfilment in your life. Why this may temporarily make you feel good, it will not bring you the harmony you need.

descriptionReversed: The Lovers Tarot reversed shows that you may be struggling to take ownership of the decisions you’ve made. This is causing conflict within you. You may be feeling uncertain of the direction your life is going in.

name: The Chariot
meaningUpright: determination, momentum, discipline, victory, direction, drive
meaningReversed: scattered, loss of control, aggression, stalling, conflict, overcompensation
description: Determination and direction: you win by choosing a destination and staying with it. Discipline turns conflicting forces into forward motion. Momentum builds fast when you commit and manage distractions.

meaningsUpright.love: The Chariot suggests that you need to conquer your emotions in order to have a successful relationship. If you and your partner have been going through a rough patch, you need to come together, communicate and work hard.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been having health issues that have been wearing you down, you feel a new burst of motivation and energy to tackle them. You may have a long road to recovery ahead but you are strong and you overcome these challenges.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: With The Chariot in a work context you should be feeling very ambitious and motivated. If you have been having any issues with work colleagues that you feel may be trying to sabotage you, put your worries aside and continue to work hard and keep your self-control.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Chariot can represent the beginning of a spiritual journey. While this journey will not be without its hurdles, it is one you are more than ready for and lead you on to greater things.

meaningsReversed.love: The overall message of The Chariot reversed in a love Tarot reading is slow down! If you are a relationship and things aren’t progressing as fast as you would like you need to have patience and be confident that things will progress in their own time.
meaningsReversed.health: As with the upright meaning, The Chariot reversed signifies a burst of motivation and energy in a health context. Just remember to pace yourself and not to rush things.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The ambition and motivation we see in The Chariot upright is still present in The Chariot reversed. However, when reversed it suggests that you are trying to run before you can walk!
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Chariot in a reversed position can show that you are ready for a spiritual journey and extremely enthusiastic. Just be mindful not to become so over-focused on ticking the boxes of what you expect to experience on this spiritual path that you close yourself off to the unexpected.

descriptionReversed: The Chariot Tarot card reversed can show that you feel powerless and are lacking direction. You need to take control of your own destiny and not let outside forces determine your path. When The Chariot reversed you are still moving but you have let go of the reins.

name: Strength
meaningUpright: courage, patience, inner power, compassion, self-control, resilience
meaningReversed: self-doubt, reactivity, insecurity, burnout, fear, loss of patience
description: True strength is calm courage, not domination. Face the challenge with patience, compassion, and steady confidence. Gentleness is the force that tames fear.

meaningsUpright.love: Strength is the Major Arcana card that represents the Leo star sign so a relationship with a Leo may be on the cards if this appears. If you are single the Strength card is an indicator that now is a great time to meet someone as your confidence will be shining through.
meaningsUpright.health: The Strength Tarot Card in a health context is a great card to get. It usually an indicator of good or improving health and feeling fit as a fiddle.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: Strength shows that now is the time to master your emotions and forge ahead. You have the skills, you have the potential, you just need to be brave and believe in yourself.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The Strength Tarot card shows a growing connection to your higher self. This connection to your higher self will give you more inner strength and balance than you dared to dream possible.

meaningsReversed.love: The Strength Tarot reversed in a love Tarot reading if you are single can show that lack of impulse control or unresolved self-esteem issues may be leading you to choose the wrong partners. This can become a vicious circle as bad relationships negatively affect your self-esteem.
meaningsReversed.health: Strength in reversal is still an indicator of good health. However, you may be lacking in self-control which could be leading to bad habits that negatively affect your health.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Strength Tarot reversed is similar to the upright meaning, in that it shows that you need to be brave and have self-belief to get ahead in your career. In the reversed position in a career Tarot reading, this Major Arcana card is a stronger indicator that you have been letting fear and anxiety hold you back.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, Strength reversed is an indicator that you have a strong connection to spirit but emotional worries a stopping you from sensing the connection. Try to let go of anxiety and self-doubt to bring this connection to the forefront.

descriptionReversed: When the Strength Tarot card appears reversed, it shows that you are not tapping into the inner strength you have. It is does not indicate a lack of strength so much as it shows that you are letting fear, anxiety or low self-esteem paralyse you. Now more than ever you need to summon your inner resolve and self-belief to pull you out of your current situation.

name: The Hermit
meaningUpright: solitude, reflection, wisdom, inner search, clarity, guidance
meaningReversed: isolation, avoidance, loneliness, withdrawal, stagnation, overthinking
description: Step back to see clearly. This is a season of reflection, research, and honest self-inquiry. Solitude is productive when it leads to wise action.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single The Hermit Tarot card represents coming out the other side of a period of loneliness and solitude that may have been needed to recuperate from past heartbreak or a bad breakup. you soon be ready for a fresh start.
meaningsUpright.health: The Hermit in a health context shows overdoing things may lead to health issues. If you find that you’re rushed off your feet, never having a minute to take a breath, The Hermit suggests that if you don’t make time for yourself to rest and reboot your health may suffer.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Hermit in a career context can show may suggest that you are putting too much focus on your career or money and materialistic pursuits, rather than sharing your attention between activities that will leave you feeling fulfilled on all levels. It can also indicate that you are wondering if you are in the right career.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The overall theme of The Hermit is spiritual enlightenment so now is the perfect time to engage in spiritual activities. Whether it’s meditation, energy work, psychic development or connecting to your own spirit guides you are coming into a time of incredible spiritual growth.

meaningsReversed.love: The Hermit reversed in a love Tarot context is strong indicator of loneliness. If you are in a relationship it suggests that you may be feeling shut out or rejected by your partner.
meaningsReversed.health: The Hermit Tarot card reversed in a health context can be an indication of mental health issues such as agoraphobia and paranoia. It can also be a stronger warning than the upright card that you need to take time out to relax or your health may suffer.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Hermit reversed can show that it’s time to start putting yourself out there career wise and making business connections after a period of working in solitude. You may be finding it tough to work alone and would benefit from doing some team projects or doing some consultancy work which will encourage you to interact with more people in your chosen field.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The Hermit reversed in a spiritual context shows that you may be spending too much time alone. Your spiritual development would benefit if you got involved activities or groups.

descriptionReversed: The Hermit Tarot card reversed suggests that you have withdrawn too much from the world or are becoming too reclusive. Solitude might have been necessary or good for you at one point but The Hermit reversed is telling you that it is time to come back to the world and the people around you. Taking time for soul-searching and self-reflection can be a great thing in moderation but too much can be damaging.

name: Wheel of Fortune
meaningUpright: change, cycles, luck, turning point, timing, opportunity
meaningReversed: resistance, bad timing, setback, repeat patterns, instability, delays
description: A turning point: cycles shift, and timing matters. Stay adaptable—change can open doors if you respond wisely. Focus on what you can control: attitude, preparation, and choices.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, Wheel of Fortune in an upright position normally shows a positive change so you could be taking the next step in your relationship or starting a new phase with your partner or even some sort of joint project. At the same time, the change the Wheel of Fortune Tarot card brings can be difficult.
meaningsUpright.health: Again, change is the theme of Wheel of Fortune in a health reading. So if you’ve been battling health issues the wheel may start to turn in your favour.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: Again the upright Wheel of Fortune is usually a good omen and an indicator of big changes coming. If you’ve always wanted to start your own business or you’ve been considering a career change now is a good time to make the change.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: Fate is smiling on you with the Wheel of Fortune in an upright position. In a spiritual context, you should use this time to develop and grow.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Wheel of Fortune Tarot reversed can represent stagnancy or the sparkle going out of the relationship. That doesn’t mean that you should automatically make a knee-jerk decision to end the relationship as all relationships have their ups and downs.
meaningsReversed.health: Wheel of Fortune reversed can show that you may be finding upheaval or disruption in another area of your life is having a knock on effect on your health. Try to remain positive and avoid letting pessimism take over.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Wheel of Fortune reversed signifies a career becoming stagnant or a period of disruption and uncertainty in your career. Again, this Major Arcana card in reverse can show unwelcome changes coming.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, you may feel like the universe is working against you and nothing is going your way with the Wheel of Fortune reversed. This may be testing your faith but even through our darkest days, the universe has a plan for us all.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Wheel of Fortune reversed Tarot card still shows change but this change is likely to be negative and unwelcome. The reversed Wheel of Fortune is a strong indicator that there is a challenging time ahead and that the change coming may be difficult to adjust to. It can represent that things had been going well and have suddenly and quite unexpectedly fallen apart.

name: Justice
meaningUpright: truth, fairness, accountability, clarity, law, balance
meaningReversed: dishonesty, bias, avoidance, unfairness, blame, imbalance
description: Truth and accountability are emphasized. Choices have consequences, and clarity arrives when you face facts. Do what’s fair—even when it’s inconvenient—and balance returns.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single, Justice can show a relationship with a person in the legal industry (judge, lawyer, legal secretary etc. ) It is the Tarot card that corresponds to Libra, so a Libra may be coming into your life.
meaningsUpright.health: If you’ve been having health issues, Justice can show that you are out of balance which is contributing to your health issues. It also cautions against overindulgence in any area of your life.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: When Justice appears in a career context, it tells you that you need to pay attention to balancing your work and personal life. Don’t forget to take adequate time out for yourself.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, one of the main themes of Justice is karma. This does not mean that you are being punished for past mistakes.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship Justice reversed can be a strong indicator of being caught out in a deception or cheating. So if you have been cheating on your partner or lying to them, expect big repercussions.
meaningsReversed.health: Again in a health context, Justice reversed shows a need for balance but it’s a stronger indicator that a lack of balance may cause health issues. Try to make time to take care of yourself and avoid overindulgence.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: Justice reversed may indicate that you are being treated unfairly in work. Perhaps you are being blamed for others mistakes or shortcomings.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: As with the upright Tarot card, Justice reversed in a spiritual context tell us that the universe may be sending you the lessons you are supposed to learn in this life. The reversed position shows that you may be trying to avoid these life lessons or outright refusing to accept them.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, Justice reversed can show injustice or avoidance of karmic justice. This may take the form of being treated unjustly in your life or situation where you are being unfairly affected by the choices or actions of others. You may feel you are being victimised or blamed for something that is not your fault.

name: The Hanged Man
meaningUpright: pause, surrender, new perspective, letting go, patience, reframe
meaningReversed: stuck, martyrdom, avoidance, impatience, wasted time, resistance
description: A deliberate pause brings a new perspective. When you stop forcing, the right solution becomes visible. Surrender here is strategic: it trades urgency for insight.

meaningsUpright.love: In a love Tarot context if you are in a relationship, The Hanged Man shows that you may be unhappy with the way your relationship is going at the moment. It can also signify that either you or your partner may be feeling the need to take a step back from the relationship to assess your options or where you want the relationship to lead.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been experiencing health issues, The Hanged Man encourages you to consider all of your treatment options. This does not mean you should reject the treatment you’ve been offered but it tells you to rethink your health issues and consider tackling them from multiple angles.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Hanged Man shows that you are feeling uncertain about your career path or feel like your career has become stagnant. You may be unclear about what steps you need to take to move your career forward.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Hanged Man tells you to be mindful of your attitude to yourself. If you have been engaging negative thinking you need to stop this as it is may affect your outcome as well as how you feel about your life.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are single, The Hanged Man in a reversed position can show that you have been repeating the same negative relationship patterns over and over without learning from your mistakes. You may be rushing from bad relationship to the next and never taking responsibility for the role you play in choosing these relationships.
meaningsReversed.health: If you have been having health issues, The Hanged Man in a reversed position tells you that you really need to think outside the box to resolve them. You may consider the possibility that issues in other areas of your life may be aggravating or even causing your health issues.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: In a work context, The Hanged Man reversed Tarot card shows that things may not be going well but you have neither the will nor inclination to deal with the issues involved. You may be resorting to blaming others or feeling like you are powerless to change your circumstances.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Hanged Man Tarot card reversed shows that you may have lost your way spiritually. You may be seeking gratification in shallow ways rather than connecting to your higher self.

descriptionReversed: The Hanged Man reversed can show that you are being impulsive and making rash decisions as a way to distract yourself from some sort of inner discontentment. This Major Arcana trump card generally shows that you may be jumping from one bad situation to the next without considering where this behaviour is taking you. Ask yourself if there are feelings you trying to avoid confronting or changes that you know need to be made but are reluctant to tackle.

name: Death
meaningUpright: ending, transformation, release, renewal, closure, rebirth
meaningReversed: clinging, fear of change, prolonged ending, stagnation, avoidance, half-measures
description: An ending clears space for transformation. This card is about honest closure, not punishment. Release what’s expired and you make room for renewal.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, Death in a love tarot context can signify that you or your partner may be holding onto a relationship that’s not working or you may be clinging to old patterns that are stopping your relationship from moving forward. Death signifies that things are going to change whether you want them to or not.
meaningsUpright.health: Don’t panic if you see the Death card in health reading, again the Death card only shows physical death in extremely rare cases and only in certain combinations! If you have been feeling like your health is never going to improve, Death can signify that a change is coming.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: Death in a career context is a warning not to get too dependent on anything that is not working for you. The only thing in life that is guaranteed is that things change.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: Physical death is a form of transformation when our spirits leave the physical body behind and transform back to the spiritual beings we all are intrinsically. The Death card represents spiritual transformation.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Death Tarot card reversed in a love tarot reading, is a strong indicator that you are resistant to a change in your relationship. You may be holding on to a relationship that has long since run its course because you feel dependent on your partner or are terrified of loneliness.
meaningsReversed.health: Death reversed can be an indicator that you are resisting tackling your health issues or being proactive in your treatments. Maybe your health woes are physical symptoms of a deeper issue and you are resisting resolving that.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: Like the upright meaning, The Death Tarot card reversed is an indicator that now might be time for a career change or new direction. You may be resistant to this change because you are afraid to let go of the security you have.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: When Death reversed appears in a spiritual context, like the upright meaning, it signifies spiritual transformation brought about by a difficult time, grief or loss in your life. However, the reversed card in a Tarot reading shows that you are extremely resistant to this change.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, Death reversed shows that you are resisting a change that is necessary for you to move forward. Nothing new can begin while you are holding on to this old negative energy. Death shows that while you are finding it difficult to let go, once you do, new energy will come into your life to give you a new brighter beginning.

name: Temperance
meaningUpright: balance, moderation, integration, patience, healing, harmony
meaningReversed: excess, imbalance, friction, impatience, overindulgence, poor boundaries
description: Balance, patience, and integration. Mix extremes into something workable and sustainable. Slow adjustment brings lasting harmony.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Temperance Tarot card is one of the best cards you can get. It signifies a harmonious relationship where you and your partner find the perfect balance of love, commitment and respect.
meaningsUpright.health: The Temperance Tarot card shows that moderation is the key to good health so if you need to get any unhealthy habits under control, you find that now is a great time to do it. If you have been experiencing any health issues, look to the areas of your life or health where you have been overdoing it or under-doing it.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: Temperance tells you that now, is a great time to set goals as you have the patience and persistence to achieve what you want. Your hard work and dedication will be noticed with Temperance upright.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, Temperance tells you to listen to your inner guidance and is an indicator that your spirit guides are all around you. Temperance can also signify that you are finding the right balance between your mind, body and spirit.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, Temperance reversed can show conflict and clashes caused by an imbalance in the relationship. This may be a result of one of you feeling like you care more than the other or feeling like the love and respect you show your partner is not reciprocated.
meaningsReversed.health: Temperance reversed in a health context is a very strong indicator that you are out of balance in some areas of your life that are having a knock on effect on your health. The Temperance Tarot card reversed can also be a sign of unhealthy or harmful excesses when it appears in a Tarot spread so be mindful of what you are putting into your body at this time.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Temperance Tarot card reversed can signify an imbalance or conflict in a work situation. You may be working too hard or not working hard enough or you could be clashing with your co-workers.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In spiritual terms, Temperance reversed tells you that you are spiritually imbalanced. You may feel like you have lost your connection to your inner guidance or your spirit guides.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, Temperance reversed shows imbalance or overindulgence. This Major Arcana card can be an indicator that you are behaving in a hasty or reckless fashion. It can be a signifier of many issues with excessive or harmful indulgences such as drinking, drug use, gambling, overeating, shopping and the list goes on.

name: The Devil
meaningUpright: attachment, temptation, shadow, compulsion, materialism, control
meaningReversed: release, detachment, recovery, breaking habits, liberation, clarity
description: Attachment and shadow patterns are highlighted. The chain is often psychological: fear, shame, compulsion, or comfort that costs too much. Name the pattern and you reclaim choice.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, The Devil can be a sign that you or your partner are feeling trapped. It may indicate a loss of freedom brought on by becoming too engrossed in a relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Devil can show poor health brought about by harmful behaviour such as drug addiction, alcoholism or compulsive overeating. It is also an indicator of mental health issues such as depression, anxiety, panic attacks, bipolar, schizophrenia etc.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Devil upright can show that you feel trapped in a job that you hate. Again, you are in control of your own life even if you don’t feel that way.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Devil can show that you have become too materialistic. Try to bring the focus back to the non-materialistic pleasures in life such as spending time with the people who make you happy or connecting to your spiritual side.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, The Devil Tarot card reversed can show that you and your partner may have been feeling stuck in a rut or felt like the relationship was on its way out but you having started to come out the other side of this. It can also be an indicator of a close call, one of you may have come close to doing something that would have irreparably damaged your relationship (e.
meaningsReversed.health: The Devil reversed is a good omen as it shows stopping harmful habits and starting on the road to recovery so if you have suffered from any sort of addiction, you may well be getting the strength to overcome it. Stay strong and focused.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Devil reversed shows that your awareness of how your behaviour and choices have influenced your current circumstances is increasing dramatically and you are ready to start taking steps to get to where you want to be. While you may have felt stuck in your job due to financial constraints or being too focused on attaining status or materialistic goals, you are starting to see the big picture and refocus on what is going to make you happy and fulfilled in your life.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: As with the general meaning, The Devil Tarot card reversed can show that you have managed to avert a dangerous or harmful situation. In a spiritual Tarot spread, this tells you that the universe has been kind enough to allow you to learn your lesson without major negative consequences.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, The Devil reversed can signify that you are becoming aware of the things that have been trapping you and the role you play in allowing them to. It is a great card for anyone battling an addiction or mental illness or engaging in harmful behaviour as it shows that you are starting to see the light and take back control of yourself and your life. You want to be free from these problems and you are starting to get the motivation to change your circumstances.

name: The Tower
meaningUpright: shock, revelation, breakthrough, collapse, truth exposed, reset
meaningReversed: avoiding collapse, slow breakdown, denial, controlled change, tension, delayed truth
description: A sudden reset breaks false structures. Upheaval is uncomfortable, but it clears deception and reveals truth. Rebuild on what’s real and you become stronger.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, The Tower can be a bad omen representing, break-ups, separation or divorce. It can also represent either you or your partner or both, going through a difficult or traumatic event that will push your relationship to its absolute limits.
meaningsUpright.health: The Tower can represent a sudden illness or an accident so be mindful of your safety and well-being. If coupled with pregnancy cards it can show a difficult pregnancy, miscarriage, abortion or stillbirth.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Tower may indicate a lack of job security. It can be a signifier of a redundancy or job loss.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: Imagine having a home you thought was solidly built and would shelter you for the rest of your life. The Tower would be a big storm that reduces your house to rubble, destroying everything you thought was secure and showing you that the foundations were not as solid as you once believed they were.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, The Tower reversed can signify that while you know your relationship is as good as over, you are avoiding actually ending it for fear of the pain it will bring. You may think you can paper over the cracks but this would be like putting a band aid on a gunshot wound.
meaningsReversed.health: The Tower reversed can show that you may be ignoring an illness or a warning sign of an illness, hoping it will go away. You need to face this head on to give yourself the best chance at recovery.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Tower reversed can show that you may be managing to hold onto your job in difficult circumstances. This can be simply a sign that you are successfully avoiding a job loss.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Tower reversed shows that you may have realised that the old beliefs that you once held dear are now proving to be false but you are resisting letting them go. Maybe you feel that if you don’t have those beliefs, you don’t know what to believe in.

descriptionReversed: The Tower Tarot card reversed can be a sign that you have narrowly avoided a disaster. you need to learn from the experience in order to prevent the lesson from coming back around again. It can also signify delaying the inevitable.

name: The Star
meaningUpright: hope, renewal, healing, inspiration, guidance, faith
meaningReversed: discouragement, low faith, cynicism, self-doubt, drained, disconnection
description: Hope, healing, and renewal. After difficulty, clarity returns and the future feels possible again. Take gentle steps toward your long-term vision.

meaningsUpright.love: The Star in a love Tarot reading can show a relationship with an Aquarius. If you are single, The Star is an indicator that you are ready to let go of any baggage you have been carrying from past relationships.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been having health issues, The Star shows that you are coming into a time of great healing. It can be a signifier for good health and for health issues being resolved in a positive way.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Star in a career context shows that you have great opportunities coming your way in terms of work. If you have been waiting to find out the outcome of a promotion or job interview, The Star is very positive sign that things are going to go in your favour or something even better is going to come your way.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Star is a great omen. It shows that you be very in tune with the spirit world.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, The Star reversed shows that you may have lost faith in the relationship or are focusing on the negative and missing the positive aspects of your relationship. Your relationship may have lost some of its spark, you may feel that the relationship has become stagnant and monotonous and that you and your partner have disconnected on some level.
meaningsReversed.health: The Star reversed can show that your health is not all that bad but any issues you have will be magnified by your anxiety and pessimism at the moment. You may be worrying about your health and blowing any symptoms way out of proportion rather than going for a simple check-up.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Star reversed shows that you may be feeling bored in your career or feel that you are stuck in a career that is going nowhere. Monotony has set in and you no longer feel the creative spark or enthusiasm you once had.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The Star reversed in a spiritual context shows that you have lost faith in the universe. You may feel like you are disconnected from spirit and you may be looking upon the difficulties you have faced in the past as an indication that you are doomed.

descriptionReversed: The Star in a reversed position can show that you are feeling hopeless. Perhaps the difficult situations you have been through in the past have drained you of your lust for life and your faith in the universe’s plan for you. The Star reversed does not indicate that things are hopeless, only that you feel they are.

name: The Moon
meaningUpright: intuition, uncertainty, dreams, illusion, anxiety, hidden factors
meaningReversed: clarity emerging, truth revealed, reduced fear, unmasking, release anxiety, understanding
description: Uncertainty and hidden factors. Emotions can distort perception, so move carefully. Verify facts, but respect your gut when something feels off.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, The Moon Tarot card in a love Tarot reading can show that you may be feeling uncertain or insecure in the relationship. If your relationship looks fine to the outside world, The Moon can show that things are not as perfect as they seem.
meaningsUpright.health: The Moon can signify mental health issues. It can be an indicator of anxiety disorders and depression.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: With The Moon Tarot card appearing in a career context, you may be very unclear or even anxious about your career direction. There may be miscommunication between you and your colleagues or superiors in a work context which could cause problems or misunderstandings.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The Moon in a spiritual context is a great card to get as it’s all about intuition. If you are interested in psychic development or healing work, you find everything flows really naturally for you and you are open to receiving messages from spirit with it.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in relationship, The Moon reversed can show deception or lies being unveiled. This could be an affair being exposed.
meaningsReversed.health: The Moon reversed can be a positive card in relation to health issues as it can show lifting of mental health issues such as depression or anxiety. However, it can also be an indicator of being unable to separate reality from fantasy and as such, if the supporting cards are negative, it can show an illness involving delusions or paranoia becoming worse.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: If you work in an artistic or creative field, The Moon reversed can show a creative block such as writer’s block. In a general career context, it can show that any uncertainty or instability that you’ve been experiencing in your career will begin to stabilise.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Moon reversed can show that you are blocking, ignoring or misinterpreting the messages spirit is trying to give you. It can be a sign that you are not tuning into your psychic powers or that your intuition is clouded.

descriptionReversed: In a general context The Moon Tarot card reversed can signify releasing fears or negative energy clearing. It can also indicate secrets or lies being exposed. If you have been experiencing fear or anxiety it should begin to subside.

name: The Sun
meaningUpright: success, joy, clarity, vitality, confidence, optimism
meaningReversed: overconfidence, ego, delayed success, low mood, hidden joy, burnout
description: Joy, success, and clear outcomes. Things make sense and progress is visible. Be seen, celebrate wins, and let optimism fuel action.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, The Sun is an indication great joy and happiness. It can be a sign of a period of fun, passion and positivity in your relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Sun is the card of vitality so you should be feeling full of life, balance, positivity and wellness when it appears. If you have been ill, The Sun is a good omen for recovery.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Sun Tarot card signifies a time of great success! New opportunities will be coming your way and you be full of optimism and enthusiasm.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Sun Tarot card can signify discovering the joy that a spiritual path has to offer. It is the card of enlightenment.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, The Sun reversed can show that you are feeling left out in the cold by your partner. Some of the spark or passion may have gone out of the relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: In a health reading, The Sun reversed can show that your attitude or negativity may be exasperating your health issues. If you have been ill, The Sun reversed shows that recovery is possible but you need to be proactive in aiding your recovery and you need to maintain a positive outlook to help boost your health.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Sun reversed can signify feeling trapped or oppressed by your career. This oppression is more than likely within your power to change.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Sun Tarot card reversed indicated that you may be struggling to embrace the joy that spirituality has to offer. You may feel that you cannot see your path ahead and have lost trust in the universe’s love for you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, The Sun Tarot card reversed can show sadness, depression and pessimism. You may be finding it difficult to focus on the positive with it. The Sun reversed does not usually mean that your situation or circumstances are all that bad but that you are feeling pessimistic and focusing on the negative which is affecting your outlook on life.

name: Judgement
meaningUpright: awakening, reckoning, renewal, calling, forgiveness, decision
meaningReversed: self-criticism, avoidance, fear of evaluation, stuck past, indecision, denial
description: Awakening and decisive movement. Evaluate, forgive, and choose the next chapter consciously. Answer what feels like purpose, not habit.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, Judgement can show that you or your partner may be judging each other too harshly. Be wary of throwing blame or accusations at each other during arguments to try and provoke a reaction, you may do more damage to your relationship than you mean to.
meaningsUpright.health: Judgement can signify a period of healing and wholeness after a difficult illness. You have come through the tough times, learned from them and you are ready and willing to take all necessary steps to help you on the road to recovery.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: Judgement can be an indication that you are being assessed or evaluated. You may be in the running for a promotion and not even know it.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, Judgement signifies spiritual awakening. You have learned the karmic lessons of the past and you now understand what the universe has been guiding you to.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, Judgement reversed can show that you are avoiding making a decision about the relationship because of self-doubt. Whether this decision is about the relationship moving forward or ending, it is a decision that needs to be made.
meaningsReversed.health: If you suffer from a long-term illness or injury, Judgement reversed may be telling you to let go of any old negativity especially if it’s relating to someone who may have caused or contributed to your injury or illness. Holding onto negativity will only make your recovery more difficult.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: Judgement reversed shows that you are at a turning point in your career and this time could make or break you in terms of success. You need to make a decision but you are paralysed by self-doubt.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, Judgement reversed signifies that you are missing or refusing to learn your karmic lessons. If you don’t learn them the universe will bring them back to you bigger and bolder.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Judgement Tarot card reversed can signify that you are allowing fear and self-doubt to hold you back from making the decisions necessary to move forward in a positive direction. Now is the time to take action. If you delay you may lose the opportunities available to you.

name: The World
meaningUpright: completion, mastery, integration, travel, success, wholeness
meaningReversed: unfinished business, delay, lack of closure, scattered, fear of ending, stagnation
description: Completion, mastery, and integration. A cycle ends successfully and you understand what you’ve gained. Celebrate, consolidate the lesson, and prepare for the next level.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, The World can signify reaching a goal you have aspired to. That may be getting married or having children or just being in a very happy, secure, loving and committed place in your relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been battling an illness or injury, The World is an excellent card to get as it represents successfully coming through adversity. It is a great omen for recovery.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The World can represent reaching your career goals. If you have gone into business for yourself, it represents reaching a point, after all the stress and uncertainty of the start-up phase when you weren’t sure it would work, where your business is a success and you can finally breathe a sigh of relief!
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The World signifies that you have come through the karmic lessons you were given and have learned from them. You now understand yourself, your path and where and how you fit into this world.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, The World reversed can show that your relationship has become stagnant. It may be that you and your partner have let things slide and you need to put more effort in to the relationship and having open and honest communication to get it back on track.
meaningsReversed.health: If you have been suffering from an illness, The World reversed can show that you need to rethink your treatments. If you have been trying the same things over and over and they have not been working, The World reversed is telling to try something different.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The World reversed can show that you have not reached the career goals you have set for yourself. It can also signify that you are falling short of your potential.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The World reversed shows that you may feel your spirit connection has become stagnant and that you are unable or have lost the will to progress. When this happens sometimes we need to try a different approach.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, The World Tarot card reversed can show that you have not accomplished what you set out to do and things have become stagnant. You may have tried to take shortcuts instead of putting in the hard work necessary to achieve your dreams. You may be throwing all your energy into trying to make something work that is not working for you.

name: Ace of Wands
meaningUpright: inspiration, initiative, courage, creative drive, ace, fire
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, inspiration, initiative, courage, creative drive, ace, fire
description: Ace of Wands highlights a lightning-bolt idea and desire to begin. An opening appears with fresh energy and clear potential. Use momentum, leadership, and creative ignition to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Ace of Wands can represent a new chapter in the relationship that brings a new lease of life to it such as getting engaged or married, buying or moving house, going travelling together or having a baby. It is a fertility, pregnancy and birth card so if you are trying to start a family its appearance is a great omen!
meaningsUpright.health: The Ace of Wands is a good omen indicating good health or good news in relation to health. It can also signify that you have renewed energy and passion in relation to a diet and fitness plan.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Ace of Wands signifies good news in relation to work and a new energy, enthusiasm and drive coming in. This is a very welcome card to see if you are job hunting as it can represent a new job or career path.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ace of Wands can see you beginning a new spiritual path or receiving an invitation to an event or gathering with other spiritual people. It might be a good idea to accept the invitation as you could gain more from the experience than you realise.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Ace of Wands reversed can represent setbacks, delays and lack of progress. It can be an indication that your relationship has become boring or predictable and you may need to put some effort in to inject some fun into it.
meaningsReversed.health: The Ace of Wands reversed can represent disappointing news in relation to health or pregnancy, fertility issues or problems conceiving. It can also represent lack of energy or lack of drive to start or stick to a diet or fitness regime.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Ace of Wands reversed signifies disappointing news in relation to work and a lack of energy, enthusiasm or drive. This is not a welcome card to see if you are job hunting as it can represent not getting a job you applied for.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ace of Wands reversed can see you feeling stuck in your current spiritual path and hesitant to try anything new even though you are finding your current path boring and predictable. You may be reluctant to accept invitations where you would have the opportunity to learn about other paths and meet spiritual people but you might benefit from giving it a go as you need something to pull you out of this rut you’re in.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Ace of Wands reversed represents delays, setbacks and disappointing news. This Minor Arcana card when reversed shows that you do not have any “get up and go” in you at the moment as it represents lack of initiative, passion, assertiveness, energy, enthusiasm, motivation, & growth. You may be stopping yourself from progressing or be slow and hesitant about starting or trying anything new.

name: Two of Wands
meaningUpright: inspiration, initiative, courage, creative drive, two, fire
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, inspiration, initiative, courage, creative drive, two, fire
description: Two of Wands highlights planning, vision, and the first map. You’re coordinating forces: desire vs reality, self vs other, vision vs logistics. Use momentum, leadership, and creative ignition to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Two of Wands is not a great omen as it can show that there is a lack of contentment in the relationship. You or your partner may be feeling restless, withdrawn or detached when it appears in your relationship Tarot spread.
meaningsUpright.health: The Two of Wands shows that you have two paths in terms of health or will need to decide which to take. This can take the form of having two possible treatment routes for an illness or injury or having to choose between sticking with your exercise regime or quitting completely and going back to old habits.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Two of Wands shows that you have two paths available to you. You may have a choice between staying in your current job/career and taking a new job or career path.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Two of Wands shows that you may be curious about another spiritual path or find yourself wanting to learn more about another religion. Don’t be afraid to explore your options, even if a new path isn’t for you there is no harm in learning about another path, you may find it holds some wisdom that could be useful to you.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Two of Wands reversed shows that you or your partner may be finding your relationship mundane and boring but you are staying together because you see it as the safest bet. This Minor Arcana card reversed can also signify that the relationship may be holding you back but you are afraid to leave as you fear the unknown.
meaningsReversed.health: The Two of Wands reversed can show that you may need a second opinion regarding a current health issue. It can show that there may be more information about your condition that has yet to be discovered or that you may need to find the root cause of your illness in order to figure out the best treatment options.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Two of Wands reversed shows that you may be limiting or restricting your choices or options in a work context. This Minor Arcana card signifies that you may have taken the safe option in your career and are now wishing you had been more daring.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Two of Wands reversed shows that you are sticking with your current religion or spiritual path not because it inspires you but because you are afraid of change and afraid of the unknown. Again, don’t be afraid to explore your options!

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Two of Wands reversed represents indecisiveness, fear of change and fear of the unknown. When reversed, it is a Minor Arcana card of lack of planning, restricted options, being held back and disappointment. It can represent staying put, deciding not to go, cancelled or delayed travel or cancelled emigration.

name: Three of Wands
meaningUpright: inspiration, initiative, courage, creative drive, three, fire
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, inspiration, initiative, courage, creative drive, three, fire
description: Three of Wands highlights expansion and sending your work outward. Growth becomes visible and support systems matter. Use momentum, leadership, and creative ignition to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Three of Wands is a good omen as it signifies moving forward, success and being happy with your choices so your relationship should be going well when it appears. It can also represent moving abroad or travelling to foreign lands so you and your partner may be travelling or moving abroad together when it appears.
meaningsUpright.health: The Three of Wands can signify recovery from an illness or injury and moving on after a period of ill health. As it is a travel Tarot card, it can show travelling overseas for treatment or getting vaccinated for travelling abroad.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Three of Wands can represent travelling overseas in relation to work or taking a job abroad. You may simply be looking at options for working abroad or considering other countries you could work in or you may be sent on a business trip abroad.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Three of Wands shows that you are feeling happy with your spiritual progress at the moment. You should be feeling fortunate and adventurous when it appears in your spiritual Tarot spread.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Three of Wands reversed is not a good omen as it signifies lack of progress, lack growth or being disappointed with your choices so your relationship may not be going well when it appears. It can also signify feeling like your wings have been clipped so if you or your partner would like to travel, you may feel that the other is restricting or holding you back.
meaningsReversed.health: The Three of Wands reversed can represent contracting an illness while abroad so make sure you have travel insurance if you are going abroad and take proper precautions if you are travelling such as getting vaccinated and wearing mosquito repellent in high risk countries. It can also represent being unhappy with the speed at which your recovery from an illness is progressing, be patient with your body, it will come back to full strength in its own time.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Three of Wands reversed can represent cancelled plans to travel overseas in relation to work or not taking a job that you are offered abroad. You may be frustrated with a lack of opportunity to progress in your current job when it appears.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Three of Wands reversed shows that you are feeling frustrated with your lack of spiritual progress at the moment. You may be struggling with your past or being haunted by it when this Minor Arcana card appears reversed in your spiritual Tarot spread.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Three of Wands reversed represents moving back home, returning from travels and homeland. It can show restriction, lack of progress, adventure or growth, failure and being unhappy with your choices or disappointed with the outcome of your situation. it also signifies lack of foresight or forward planning or holding on the past and being haunted by it.

name: Ace of Cups
meaningUpright: emotion, connection, intuition, compassion, ace, water
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, emotion, connection, intuition, compassion, ace, water
description: Ace of Cups highlights an open heart and emotional renewal. An opening appears with fresh energy and clear potential. Use emotional intelligence, bonding, and healing to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single the Ace of Cups is a great omen as it represents new relationships or romance. Now is a great time to meet new people!
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been having health issues, the Ace of Cups is an indication of good things to come for you. You may see an improvement in your health or an increase in your energy levels with the fresh start the Ace of Cups can bring.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: If you are looking for work, the Ace of Cups is a positive omen as it shows new opportunities coming your way. If you have a job, the Ace of Cups can signify a promotion.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ace of Cups is a sign that you open your heart to the love the universe is sending to you. You should feel a deep connection to spirit when it appears and you may find new spiritual gifts or abilities come your way.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are single, the Ace of Cups in a reversed position can signify that you may be finding it difficult to find or maintain a relationship at this time. This may be due to repressing emotions or being unwilling or unable to approach new relationships with an open heart as you are still holding on to your feelings for an unrequited love.
meaningsReversed.health: The Ace of Cups Tarot card reversed can show that blocked or repressed emotional issues may be having a negative effect on your health or depleting your energy levels. It can also signify fertility issues, difficult pregnancies, miscarriage or stillbirth.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Ace of Cups reversed can signify that you are feeling unfulfilled in your career. You may be finding that you feel creatively blocked or uninspired in your current position.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ace of Cups reversed can signify that you are blocking or repressing your intuition. You may be feeling disconnected from spirit or that you have lost faith in the universe when it appears.

descriptionReversed: In a reversed position, The Ace of Cups Tarot card generally can show sadness, pain or blocked/repressed emotions. It can also signify that you may receive some bad or upsetting news. This Minor Arcana card reversed can show that you may find that you are not in the mood for socialising or meeting new people.

name: Two of Cups
meaningUpright: emotion, connection, intuition, compassion, two, water
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, emotion, connection, intuition, compassion, two, water
description: Two of Cups highlights connection and mutual choice. You’re coordinating forces: desire vs reality, self vs other, vision vs logistics. Use emotional intelligence, bonding, and healing to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: The Two of Cups is a great card to get! If you are single it represents a blossoming romance or the offer of a relationship with a person who you share a strong connection with and who will be mutually attracted to you.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been suffering from health problems, the Two of Cups is a good omen indicating that things should be coming back into balance very soon. If you are pregnant, the Two of Cups can sometimes indicate a twin pregnancy, look to the supporting cards to confirm this.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Two of Cups can represent a strong and successful business partnership. If you are considering entering into a business partnership with someone when it appears, it is a good omen that shows that you and your business partner will work well together and will have similar goals and mutual respect for each other.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Two of Cups shows that your connection to spirit should be strong at this time and you be finding balance and harmony on your spiritual path. you be very open to the love and positive energy the universe is sending you.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are single, the Two of Cups Tarot card reversed can signify a romance with someone who you are incompatible with. It can show that someone you are dating may blow hot and cold on you.
meaningsReversed.health: The Two of Cups reversed can suggest that disharmony, stress or tension may be causing a knock-on effect on your health. You see a lack of balance within you manifesting itself in physical symptoms such as headaches or migraines, high blood pressure or chronic fatigue.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Two of Cups reversed can signify dissolving a business partnership that has turned sour. You and your business partner may no longer have the same goals or respect for each other that you once did.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Two of Cups reversed can show that you are disconnected from the love and positive energy the universe is sending you. You may find it difficult to connect to spirit and find that you powers are very off balance at the moment.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Two of Cups Tarot card reversed can show a lack of harmony or balance in your life. It can signify that you may fall victim to some form of inequality, abuse or bullying. Again, while this Minor Arcana card in a reversed position usually relates to a romantic relationship, it can also signify falling out with a friend or being in a friendship that is imbalanced or one-sided in some way.

name: Three of Cups
meaningUpright: emotion, connection, intuition, compassion, three, water
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, emotion, connection, intuition, compassion, three, water
description: Three of Cups highlights friendship, celebration, and support. Growth becomes visible and support systems matter. Use emotional intelligence, bonding, and healing to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single, the Three of Cups Tarot can show that someone from your past may reappear in your life in a romantic capacity. It can also indicate that you have an abundance of potential suitors after a period of solitude or loneliness.
meaningsUpright.health: The Three of Cups Tarot card shows that you may have a lot of social events or celebrations coming up that could tempt you into overindulgence or excessive partying. Enjoy yourself but be mindful of the impact excessive indulgence could have on your health and try to moderate things.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Three of Cups can show that there will be a celebration in relation to your work or career. This may be in the form of graduating from a course, a successful launch event for a business, a celebration of the successful completion of a project or an office party.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Three of Cups can show that you may find yourself doing group work or interacting with others on a spiritual path in group scenarios that will boost your energy and teach you new ways of connecting to spirit. Embrace these new spiritual friends and accept the opportunities to learn.
