meaningsReversed.love: If you are single, the Three of Cups reversed can show a short term relationship that won’t last is coming your way. The relationship may be a joy to begin with but it will quickly fizzle out.
meaningsReversed.health: The Three of Cups reversed can be a strong indicator that you be over-indulging or partying too much to the detriment of your health. The Three of Cups can be an indicator of a miscarriage or termination thus cancelling a baby shower or the celebration of a birth.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Three of Cups reversed may indicate that people in your workplace or team may give off the impression that they are team players but could be secretly trying sabotage or damage a project to make you look bad. It can also indicate that the gossip mill may be in overdrive in your workplace so try to focus on your work, remain professional and don’t give the gossips any ammunition.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, if you have been doing spiritual work in a group or have the opportunity to, the Three of Cups reversed can show that there may be some in the group who do not have good intentions. Trust your instincts about people, if someone acts nice to your face but you have a bad feeling about them, go with your gut.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Three of Cups Tarot card reversed can show celebrations being cancelled. This may take the form of a cancelled party, a cancelled wedding or an engagement being broken off to name but a few. The Three of Cups reversed can signify that your social life may be non-existent at the moment or that you’ve grown apart from your friends.

name: Ace of Swords
meaningUpright: truth, communication, analysis, decision, ace, air
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, truth, communication, analysis, decision, ace, air
description: Ace of Swords highlights a breakthrough in clarity and truth. An opening appears with fresh energy and clear potential. Use clarity, strategy, and honest communication to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Ace of Swords can show that you may be facing a challenge in your relationship. This Minor Arcana card tells you that you get to the truth of the matter and breakthrough the fog that has been clouding your ability to see this situation clearly.
meaningsUpright.health: The Ace of Swords shows that you discover the motivation and mental clarity you need to moderate your excesses and get control of any bad habits or start a new health plan. It can also represent needing surgery possibly due to an accidental injury so be mindful when it appears!
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Ace of Swords can represent getting a new job, promotion or project which will provide you with a stimulating environment or mentally stimulating people to bounce your ideas off. It can also signify a time in your career or work life where you be brainstorming or coming up with new ideas and communicating them to your colleagues or team or taking charge of a new venture with vision and focus.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: Fresh new ideas abound when the Ace of Swords appears in a spirituality Tarot reading! You may be letting go of old belief systems that don’t serve you any longer.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Ace of Swords reversed can show conflict or confusion in a relationship. This Minor Arcana card reversed can tell you that miscommunication or a lack of communication may simply be causing issues in your relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: The Ace of Swords reversed can show that mental stress or a lack of mental clarity may be having a negative impact on your health. This may be manifesting itself in stress related symptoms such as an inability to concentrate, migraines, memory loss or fatigue.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Ace of Swords reversed can represent failing a job interview or getting a new job, promotion or project which lacks the stimulation you need or isn’t mentally challenges enough to hold your attention. It can also signify that you are experiencing creative blocks in relation to your career or work life.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The Ace of Swords reversed can show that you pursuing new belief systems that do not bring any benefit to your life. It can also indicate that you may be letting hate triumph over love.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Ace of Swords reversed can represent a lack of ideas, misinformation, confusion and failure. It can also indicate intellectual inability, lack of mental clarity, memory loss and an inability to concentrate. This Minor Arcana card reversed can signify a lack of communication, creative blocks, lack of vision and frustration.

name: Two of Swords
meaningUpright: truth, communication, analysis, decision, two, air
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, truth, communication, analysis, decision, two, air
description: Two of Swords highlights a stalemate and difficult choice. You’re coordinating forces: desire vs reality, self vs other, vision vs logistics. Use clarity, strategy, and honest communication to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Two of Swords can show a stalemate or a relationship at a crossroads. It may be that you and your partner have been arguing frequently lately or cannot agree on an important relationship decision and have called a temporary truce.
meaningsUpright.health: The Two of Swords shows that blocked unexpressed emotions may be at the centre of any health issues or physical discomfort you are experiencing. Blocked emotions or holding on to anxiety or resentment can block the chakras (energy centres in the body) leading to physical manifestations in the form of illnesses and injuries.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Two of Swords shows that you may be caught in the middle of a conflict at work. You may be asked to choose between two colleagues with opposing views.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The Two of Swords shows that your spiritual path is not clear to you at the moment. Finding the balance within you is the key here.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Two of Swords reversed shows that you may be experiencing emotional turmoil about a decision you need to make regarding your relationship leading you to become completely indecisive. Anxiety or fear may be overwhelming you to the point that you are emotionally detaching from your partner rather than deal with the issues at hand.
meaningsReversed.health: The Two of Swords reversed shows that you may be struggling with finding a healthy balance in between your emotions and your mind, which may be the root of any health issues. Overwhelming anxiety, worry or stress you could be leading to a collection of physical symptoms or just generally not feeling your best.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Two of Swords reversed shows that a conflict at work may be causing you an overwhelming amount of stress or anxiety. It can show delays or postponements of projects or promotions.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The Two of Swords reversed tells you that while it is good to familiarise yourself with information on spiritual practices, there is such thing as information overload! Don’t make your spiritual path a purely academic exercise by reading every book there is to read on every spiritual practice every conceived.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Two of Swords reversed represents indecision, delays or postponement. It shows that fear, worry, anxiety or stress is overwhelming you and you may be experiencing emotional or mental turmoil as a result leading to an inability to make a decision. It can also represent holding onto resentment or anxiety and being overloaded with more information that you can handle.

name: Three of Swords
meaningUpright: truth, communication, analysis, decision, three, air
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, truth, communication, analysis, decision, three, air
description: Three of Swords highlights heartache and honest grief. Growth becomes visible and support systems matter. Use clarity, strategy, and honest communication to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Three of Swords is not a great omen as it represents tears, heartache, heartbreak, sorrow and conflict. This does not have to mean the end of your relationship but it does strongly indicate that there are some difficult issues that need to be addressed in order for the relationship to survive.
meaningsUpright.health: The Three of Swords is not a great omen as it can show ill-health, surgery and disorders. Your health or the health of someone you care about may not be as great as you would hope and you be experiencing a level of sadness or disillusionment with regards to this.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Three of Swords represents stress, disillusionment or losses so it is not a great omen. This Minor Arcana card can signify the grief and loss experienced due to the sudden loss of a job or redundancy.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Three of Swords shows that you are in need of healing. Recent events or losses have left you feeling bereft and sorrowful.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Three of Swords reversed can show that you are moving into a period of reconciliation or forgiveness in the relationship. You are ready to let go of the pain or heartache your relationship caused you in the past and to forgive and move forward.
meaningsReversed.health: The Three of Swords reversed can signify a return to health after a period of ill-health, surgery or disorders. You should be feeling much more optimistic about your chances of recovering or healing.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Three of Swords reversed can represent a stressful work or career situation starting to resolve itself and optimism coming in. You may be feeling much more upbeat and your work environment may be much more positive and happy.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Three of Swords reversed can show a time of forgiveness and healing after a loss or heartbreak. Recent events or losses left you feeling bereft and sorrowful but you have come through that and are finally healing the pain.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Three of Swords reversed represents overcoming unhappiness, heartache, sorrow and sadness. When reversed, it is a Minor Arcana card of optimism, overcoming grief or depression and releasing pain. When it appears it generally shows that you are recovering from your heartbreak and getting over the worst part of a bad situation or event.

name: Ace of Pentacles
meaningUpright: work, money, body, stability, ace, earth
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, work, money, body, stability, ace, earth
description: Ace of Pentacles highlights a tangible opportunity and new resource. An opening appears with fresh energy and clear potential. Use building, saving, growing, and creating security to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single, the Ace of Pentacles shows that you have a fresh start coming in terms of love. You should be meeting someone new soon, potentially through work or business.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been experiencing health problems, the Ace of Pentacles is a positive omen to get in a Tarot reading as it can represent your health improving. In a general health context, it can show that now would be a great time to begin new health habits or implement lifestyle choices that will benefit your health for years to come.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Ace of Pentacles is a great card to get in a Tarot spread as it represents a positive new beginning. This may take the form of a promotion, new job or new business opportunity.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ace of Pentacles shows that now would be a great time to try something new in terms of your spiritual practices or development. Don’t be afraid to experiment with different practices.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are single, the Ace of Pentacles reversed can be a warning not to miss out on opportunities for love in the future. It can also indicate that the loss of the security of a previous relationship may be leaving you feeling vulnerable and anxious.
meaningsReversed.health: If you have been experiencing health problems, the Ace of Pentacles reversed unfortunately can represent delays or setbacks in terms of recovery. In a general health context, it can simply indicate that you have not put energy and forethought into looking after your health.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Ace of Pentacles reversed is not a great card to get Tarot Spread as it can represent a new job, business or opportunity being delayed or falling through completely. It can signify a job loss, redundancy, a job offer that has poor financial prospects or not getting a promotion you wanted.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ace of Pentacle reversed shows that you may be missing opportunities for spiritual growth or that focus on material matter may be delaying your spiritual development or sending you off course on your spiritual path. Try to refocus on your true spiritual self rather than focusing on material possession or wealth.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Ace of Pentacles reversed represents missed opportunities or lack of opportunities. It is a not a good card to get in a Tarot spread as it can represent opportunities, prospects or deals falling through. It can also signify delays, lack of planning and poor control so make sure you are putting the work and planning into achieving your goals when it appears.

name: Two of Pentacles
meaningUpright: work, money, body, stability, two, earth
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, work, money, body, stability, two, earth
description: Two of Pentacles highlights balancing resources and priorities. You’re coordinating forces: desire vs reality, self vs other, vision vs logistics. Use building, saving, growing, and creating security to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in relationship, the Two of Pentacles can show that you and your partner may have big financial decisions to make together such as getting a mortgage, buying a car or taking out a significant loan together. It can also be an indicator that you have a choice to make in terms of the future of the relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Two of Pentacles advises you to remember to balance your work life and personal life with your health needs. Be sure to take time out to eat healthily and exercise.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Two of Pentacles can signify that you have a decision to make in terms of business. For example, you may be thinking about starting your own business or you could be thinking of leaving your current secure job for a new job but are not sure whether to risk it or not.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Two of Pentacles shows that you are trying to find balance in all areas of your life which will allow you to flourish and progress along your spiritual path. You are also realising that there is more to life than material wealth and beginning to appreciate the fulfilment a balanced mind, body and spirit can bring.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Two of Pentacles reversed can show that you are trying to juggle too much and not finding time for the relationship. Work, financial stress, family issues etc.
meaningsReversed.health: The Two of Pentacles reversed shows that you are overextending yourself in other areas of your life which may be having a detrimental effect on your health. Having too many balls in the air can cause you serious stress and anxiety which could be manifesting itself in physical illness or injury.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Two of Pentacles reversed can show that you are taking on too much and spreading yourself way too thin. Juggling too much is a recipe for failure, you need to prioritise and delegate some of your work load if possible.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Two of Pentacles reversed can show that you are lacking spiritual balance in your life which may be preventing you from pursuing your spiritual path. This may be because you are too focused on work or gaining material wealth or because you are spreading yourself too thin trying to do everything.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Two of Pentacles reversed can show that you are biting off more than you can chew! You may be trying to keep too many balls in the air and finding it impossible to maintain the balance between the various areas of your life. This Minor Arcana card represents feeling overwhelmed, overextending yourself and lack of organisation.

name: Three of Pentacles
meaningUpright: work, money, body, stability, three, earth
meaningReversed: blocked/imbalanced, work, money, body, stability, three, earth
description: Three of Pentacles highlights skill, teamwork, and building craft. Growth becomes visible and support systems matter. Use building, saving, growing, and creating security to move the situation forward without losing balance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Three of Pentacles shows that you are committed to the relationship and are putting the effort in to it to make things work. If you have been having issues in the relationship, it can be a sign that you may seek the help of a relationship counsellor to overcome your issues.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been trying to improve your health or fitness, the Three of Pentacles Tarot card is a great omen to get as it shows that all of your hard work and determination will be starting to pay off and you should be feeling the benefits soon. Keep trying until you reach your goals, you can do it.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Three of Pentacles shows is a great work ethic, commitment and determination. you be putting a lot of effort into your career or business and building on previous successes when it appears.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Three of Pentacles shows that you be learning or studying new spiritual practices. It is also a sign that if you put the effort into your spiritual development you reap the rewards.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Three of Pentacles reversed can show that a third party may be causing friction in your relationship. It can also indicate a lack of commitment or growth.
meaningsReversed.health: The Three of Pentacles reversed tells you that you have to put the effort in if you want to see results. If you have been having health issues, it advises you that you need to take proactive steps to help yourself if you want to improve your health.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Three of Pentacles reversed is not a great omen as it can show that you have lost your motivation, dedication or commitment and the quality of your work is suffering greatly as a result. When it appears, it does not mean you lack ability.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Three of Pentacles reversed shows that you need to open and willing to learn if you want to make progress on your spiritual path. If you are finding that you are reluctant to move forward, you need to examine why.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Three of Pentacles reversed is not a great card to get in a Tarot spread as it shows that you are not learning from your mistakes or are unwilling to do so. You may be overwhelmed with the sense that you do not know what you are doing. However, you are not putting the effort into learning!

name: Four of Wands
meaningUpright: Four of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Four of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Four of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Four of Wands is a great omen representing happy family life, success, stability, security and laying down roots so your relationship should be going very well when it appears. It is also a Minor Arcana card signifying celebrations and as su….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Four of Wands is a great omen representing happy family life, success, stability, security and laying down roots so your relationship should be going very well when it appears. It is also a Minor Arcana card signifying celebrations and as such, can represent parties, welcoming ceremonies, baptisms and family coming together.
meaningsUpright.health: The Four of Wands is a good omen as it signifies good health and vitality and returning to good health after an illness. It is also a happy family card so a good omen to get if you are pregnant.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Four of Wands shows that things should be going well in work at the moment. Your work environment is a pleasant and supportive one and you should be getting along well with your colleagues when it appears.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Four of Wands can represent ceremonies and community so you may have rituals and events to attend within your religious or spiritual community. If you are invited to take part in events or workshops it is good omen indicating that you be made to feel welcome and will find acceptance and support at those events.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Four of Wands reversed is not a great omen as it can represent unhappy family life, failure, instability, insecurity, neglect and being uprooted so your relationship may be going through a tough or an unpredictable time when it appears. When reversed, it is also a Minor Arcana card signifying cancelled or postponed celebrations and family being divided so it can show that you and your partner may not be seeing eye-to-eye or you may be having some issues with getting your family to accept your relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: The Four of Wands reversed can show shaky or poor health. It can signify that you are not taking enough time out to stop and smell the roses.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Four of Wands reversed shows that things may not be going well in work at the moment. Your work environment is not a pleasant or supportive one.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Four of Wands reversed can represent cancelled ceremonies and lack of community spirit so you may find that rituals and events you were meant to attend within your religious or spiritual community are cancelled. If you are invited to take part in events or workshops it is not a great good omen as it can show that you not feel like you fit it or find the support and acceptance you need at those events.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Four of Wands reversed represents unhappy families, being jilted or cancelled celebrations, surprises, parties, or events. It can signify leaving home, postponed or cancelled reunions, feeling like you don’t fit in, not being made to feel welcome and lack of support. This Minor Arcana card when reversed can show failure, lack of achievement, neglect, instability, insecurity and being transient or uprooted.

name: Five of Wands
meaningUpright: Five of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Five of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Five of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Five of Wands can represent rows, arguments, conflict and fighting. You and your partner may not see eye-to eye when it appears.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Five of Wands can represent rows, arguments, conflict and fighting. You and your partner may not see eye-to eye when it appears.
meaningsUpright.health: The Five of Wands can represent battling with or successfully fighting off an illness. It can also be an indication that you need reduce your adrenaline and stress levels or you may leave yourself prone to stress related illnesses such as high blood pressure.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Five of Wands can represent conflict or competition in the workplace and can show strikes and chaos. You might find yourself having personality clashes with colleagues or having to compete for clients or projects or just to get noticed.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Five of Wands shows that you are experiencing a great deal of spiritual conflict that is clouding your ability to see your path. If you are attempting to develop your intuitive side you may find it difficult to put aside your ego and the negative voices that discourage you.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Five of Wands reversed can represent an ending of rows, arguments, conflict or fighting. You and your partner may be starting to turn a corner after a period of turbulence in the relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: The Five of Wands reversed can represent unsuccessfully trying to fight off an illness. It can also signify that failing to get your stress levels under control may be leading you to more serious medical problems like heart attack or stroke.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Five of Wands reversed can represent the ending of conflict or competition in the workplace. You and your colleagues may join forces to complete an important project and all competitiveness is put aside to work as a team and get the job done.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Five of Wands reversed shows that your previous inner conflict has been resolved leaving you more focused with a sense of inner peace, calm and harmony.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Five of Wands reversed represents the end of rows, arguments, conflict, fighting and disagreements. It signifies ending struggles, finding common ground or solutions, reaching agreements, compromise, cooperation, peace and harmony. This Minor Arcana card reversed can also represent battle fatigue, fear of confrontation, shyness, suppressing your temper and feeling intimidated.

name: Six of Wands
meaningUpright: Six of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Six of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Six of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Six of Wands is a great omen indicating success, stability, strength and sharing your success. You and your partner should be riding high and achieving your goals together.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Six of Wands is a great omen indicating success, stability, strength and sharing your success. You and your partner should be riding high and achieving your goals together.
meaningsUpright.health: The Six of Wands can show good health or victory over a disease or success in battling an illness so it is a very good omen to receive if you have been ill. It can also represent a successful return to sports after an injury.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Six of Wands represents success and victory so it is a very good omen. You may have won a promotion or new job or successfully completed a project producing great results.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Six of Wands sees people looking to you for guidance. Assist those that you can help as you have the leadership qualities required in abundance.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Six of Wands reversed is not a great omen as it can show failure, disloyalty and instability. You relationship may lack the qualities needed to endure the difficult times.
meaningsReversed.health: The Six of Wands reversed can show poor health or a relapse of an illness or disease or success that you had been given the all clear on. It can also represent a disappointing return to sports or fitness after an injury or an injury caused by a fall.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Six of Wands reversed can represent lack of success or defeat so it is not a very good omen to get. You may have lost out on a promotion or new job or produced poor results on a work project or target.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Six of Wands reversed shows that you may be following crowd a bit when it comes to your spiritual development and just going along with others for the sake of fitting in. Your spiritual path is uniquely yours so you need to decide your own course.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Six of Wands reversed represents losing, failure, lack of achievement, recognition, endurance, confidence or support. When reversed, it is a Minor Arcana card of mob or pack mentality, being a follower or being hunted. It shows that someone is being arrogant, egotistical, fame hungry or a diva and that pride comes before a fall.

name: Seven of Wands
meaningUpright: Seven of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Seven of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Seven of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Seven of Wands tells you that you have some challenges coming up and if you want your relationship to go the distance you are going to have to fight for it. This challenge may come from inside the relationship in the form of you or your part….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Seven of Wands tells you that you have some challenges coming up and if you want your relationship to go the distance you are going to have to fight for it. This challenge may come from inside the relationship in the form of you or your partner trying to blame each other for issues.
meaningsUpright.health: The Seven of Wands can signify you having to fight to overcome an illness or injury. it can also represent an illness or condition that you have to work hard to keep under control.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Seven of Wands can represent fighting to protect what you have. When it appears you may find that you have a battle on your hands to hold on to your success or position.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Seven of Wands shows that you may have to stand up for your spiritual beliefs so someone may challenge your belief system, call your morals into question or try to ridicule or harass you for your beliefs. You have a right to your belief system so don’t allow anyone else to try and take that away from you.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Seven of Wands reversed is not a great omen as it shows you quitting, giving up or letting go in the face of challenges coming up. Again, if you want your relationship to go the distance you are going to have to fight for it.
meaningsReversed.health: The Seven of Wands reversed is not a great omen as it can signify someone losing the energy or will to fight to overcome an illness or injury. it can also represent an illness or condition spiralling out of control.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Seven of Wands reversed can represent not protecting what you have achieved or worked for. When it appears you may find that you have taken your eye off the ball and someone else has taken your place.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Seven of Wands reversed shows that you may fold on your beliefs when they are challenged. There is nothing wrong with learning about new paths or religions and embracing them if they work for you but be mindful that you are not just following the crowd because you want to fit in!

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Seven of Wands reversed represents folding on your beliefs, yielding, quitting, giving up and giving in. It signifies admitting defeat, surrendering and lack of courage or stamina. This Minor Arcana card can represent weakness, failing to protect or defend someone or something you care about and being exhausted, burnt-out or worn down.

name: Eight of Wands
meaningUpright: Eight of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Eight of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Eight of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Eight of Wands is a good omen indicating progress, exciting times, infatuation and being swept of your feet. Whether the relationship is new or you’ve been together for years this Minor Arcana card brings a rush of love, excitement, sex and….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Eight of Wands is a good omen indicating progress, exciting times, infatuation and being swept of your feet. Whether the relationship is new or you’ve been together for years this Minor Arcana card brings a rush of love, excitement, sex and passion.
meaningsUpright.health: The Eight of Wands can represent a rapid recovery from an injury or illness. It can also represent being very physically active or seeing a newly implemented diet or exercise regime produce results quickly.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Eight of Wands can represent work related travel or things taking off a great speed. You may find yourself going places in the physical sense of attending meetings or overseas conferences or you may find your career is going places!
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Eight of Wands shows that you should be experiencing in a big upswing in your positive energy. If you have been trying to develop your psychic or healing abilities you should find yourself gaining momentum and progressing quickly.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Eight of Wands reversed is not a good omen indicating a lack of progress or slow progress, lack of romance and a relationship losing its momentum. Whether the relationship is new or you’ve been together for years this Minor Arcana card reversed can represent a lack of energy, excitement, sex or passion.
meaningsReversed.health: The Eight of Wands reversed can represent a slow recovery from an injury/illness or health suddenly taking a nose dive. It can also represent being inactive or too active leading to fatigue or a newly implemented diet or exercise regime not producing results as quickly as you hoped.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Eight of Wands reversed can represent things taking off too quickly or not quick enough and cancelled travel. You may find meetings or overseas conferences are cancelled or that your career is just not progressing at the rate you hoped it would.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Eight of Wands reversed shows that you may be experiencing a lack of energy or being affected by negative energy when it appears. If you have been trying to develop your psychic or healing abilities you may find that things are not progressing as quickly as you would like.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Eight of Wands reversed represents slowness, slow progress and lack of speed, movement or action. When reversed, it is a Minor Arcana card of restriction, returning from travels or delayed or cancelled travel or holidays. It can signify late starts, bad timing, losing momentum, missed opportunities and unfinished business.

name: Nine of Wands
meaningUpright: Nine of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Nine of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Nine of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Nine of Wands shows that you and your partner have been going through a rough time. Whether that’s in how you relate to each other or just in life in general, recent events have left you sapped of all energy.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Nine of Wands shows that you and your partner have been going through a rough time. Whether that’s in how you relate to each other or just in life in general, recent events have left you sapped of all energy.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been ill for some time, the Nine of Wands can show that the battle with your illness up to now has used up most of your energy. it tells you that you need to summon the last of your strength and push forward.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Nine of Wands represents an ongoing battle, perseverance and fighting through the tough times. The reality of the work you have taken on may be hitting home when it appears as the Nine of Wands shows that you are mid-way through a battle.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Nine of Wands shows that you have gone through a difficult time and you are feeling burnt out and worn out. However, things are looking up and you have learned your karmic lessons so you be able to move forward on your spiritual path!

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Nine of Wands reversed can show that you and your partner may have been arguing previously and have now gotten locked in a stalemate where you are both digging your heals in and refusing to compromise. Alternatively, this Minor Arcana card can suggest that you have no fight left and want to withdraw from the relationship altogether.
meaningsReversed.health: The Nine of Wands reversed can show being unable to continue to fight an illness or being unable to keep up the pretence that you are not suffering. It is also a stronger indication of a chronic illness or the return of an old injury or illness causing you problems.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Nine of Wands reversed can represent having no fight left or stubbornly refusing to compromise or change. You may feel like are getting nowhere in your job or with a current project and that you have put everything into it but to no avail.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Nine of Wands reversed again shows that you have gone through a difficult time. You are feeling exhausted but there is an element of rigidity with it that suggests you are digging your heels in and refusing to accept the lessons the universe is trying to send you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Nine of Wands reversed represents refusing to compromise or give in, being stubborn, rigid or obstinate. It can signify being the last one standing or having a chip on your shoulder. Alternatively, this Minor Arcana card reversed can signify a stalemate, withdrawal, retreat, giving up, having no fight left or no backbone.

name: Ten of Wands
meaningUpright: Ten of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Ten of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Ten of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Ten of Wands shows that you are overloaded or overburdened by the relationship. You may feel as though your partner takes you for granted, you may be carrying the full weight of the relationship on your shoulders while your partner takes….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Ten of Wands shows that you are overloaded or overburdened by the relationship. You may feel as though your partner takes you for granted, you may be carrying the full weight of the relationship on your shoulders while your partner takes a back seat and you may feel saddled with all the stress and responsibility of the relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Ten of Wands shows that stress or burdens are having a negative impact on your health and may be physically manifesting in illness or injuries. You need to take care of yourself first and foremost.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Ten of Wands represent stress, burdens and being overloaded. You may have bitten off way more than you can chew when it appears.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ten of Wands suggests that you have lost your way a little bit or lost your focus. You may feel you have gone off course on your spiritual path or that the stresses and burdens of your life have taken you away from your path.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Ten of Wands reversed can show that you are offloading some of your stresses and responsibilities thus leaving room for the fun and spontaneity to come back. Your partner may be taking on more duties and sharing burdens making you closer and more connected.
meaningsReversed.health: The Ten of Wands reversed shows that you may be lessening the stress or burdens that were having a negative impact on your health which should see your symptoms improve. However, on the flip side it can be an indication that you have ignored these warning signs too much and are headed for a collapse or serious illness.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Ten of Wands reversed can represent reducing burdens and responsibilities or crumbling under the pressure of excessive burdens. You may be finding ways to reduce your workload when this Minor Arcana card appears reversed.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ten of Wands reversed tells you that you must make time for yourself. You may think you are helping others by giving them every bit of energy you have but you are heading for a serious burn out.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Ten of Wands reversed represents having too much responsibility and stress or a cross that’s too heavy to bear. When reversed, this Minor Arcana card can signify insurmountable problems, flogging a dead horse and working hard but getting nowhere. It suggests that you are pushing yourself so far that you are on the brink of a collapse or a breakdown.

name: Page of Wands
meaningUpright: Page of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Page of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Page of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship, the Page of Wands can show that romantic messages or good news may be coming your way. This Minor Arcana card can also represent a new wave of passion and playfulness for your relationship, so be prepared for some exciting days and nights….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Page of Wands can show that romantic messages or good news may be coming your way. This Minor Arcana card can also represent a new wave of passion and playfulness for your relationship, so be prepared for some exciting days and nights when it appears.
meaningsUpright.health: The Page of Wands would indicate that you need to take action to improve your health or to get moving. This may be in the form of starting a new exercise regime, improving your diet by starting a healthy eating plan or just generally being more proactive about your health and fitness.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Page of Wands can show that you are in the early stages of or thinking of starting a new job, project or business that you are very excited about when it appears. Make sure you have thought through your new venture as the Page of Wands has a tendency to jump into things head first without any forethought.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Page of Wands can show that you are about to take a new direction on your spiritual path. An exciting new phase of exploration and discovery awaits you when this Minor Arcana card appears.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Page of Wands reversed can show that setback in a relationship. This Minor Arcana card reversed can show that the initial romance has worn off and you are seriously considering if you and your partner have enough in common to make a relationship work.
meaningsReversed.health: The Page of Wands reversed can show that you either have a lot of pent up energy or a lack of energy. If you have been ill or injured and trying to recover, it could indicate that you are lacking the energy to get moving again or alternatively, that a bit of cabin fever has kicked in and you can’t wait to get moving again.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Page of Wands reversed can show that you may have ideas about where you want to be in your career or business but you have no idea how to accomplish this or you are not putting the work in. There can also be a lack of ambition, drive, enthusiasm or energy when it appears.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, The Page of Wands reversed can show that you are fearful of taking new direction on your spiritual path. In order to grow and learn we must step out of our comfort zone.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Page of Wands reversed represents bad or delayed news and set-backs. This may take the form of letters, phone calls or word of mouth. This Minor Arcana card reversed can show that you may be lacking ideas or creativity or feeling uninspired or demotivated.

name: Knight of Wands
meaningUpright: Knight of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Knight of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Knight of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Knight of Wands can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. You should be excited about yo….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Knight of Wands can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. You should be excited about your relationship and proactively putting the work in to make it a success when it appears.
meaningsUpright.health: The Knight of Wands is usually a good omen in terms of health as it shows you full or energy and enthusiasm. it is also a card of haste, so be mindful that you don’t injure yourself by rushing too fast with all the activities you are involved in at the moment.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Knight of Wands can show that you are changing jobs or launching your own business when it appears. This Minor Arcana card signifies high energy, enthusiasm and being up for a challenge.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Knight of Wands shows that having recently discovered a new spiritual path or practice you be throwing yourself into it with gusto. You are enthusiastic and energetic at the moment but don’t be too hasty!

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Knight of Wands reversed can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. If this Minor Arcana card reversed represents your partner, beware, it can signify someone who is abusive, jealous and extremely aggressive.
meaningsReversed.health: The Knight of Wands reversed is not a great omen as it can show that you are overdoing it and heading for burn out. It can also indicate that you may have jumped into a new health regime or exercise plan with a little too much haste and may injure yourself as a result.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Knight of Wands reversed is not a great card to see as it shows that you are unfocused in your career. It can show that you have not found the career that you really want and are mindlessly changing from job to job without a clue of where you are heading or what you want to do.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Knight of Wands reversed can show a break from your old spiritual ways. You may completely let go of your old religion or practices, deciding that they no longer work for you which may come as a shock to the people closest to you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Knight of Wands reversed shows that things are not going as well as you expected and any ventures you have taken on are likely to experience delays or setback. You may be lacking ambition, enthusiasm or self-discipline to make your ventures a success and could be feeling fearful and passive when it appears. Alternatively, it can show that you are being overly confident or competitive, arrogant or cocky.

name: Queen of Wands
meaningUpright: Queen of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: Queen of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: Queen of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship the Queen of Wands can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. Remember, she can be fiery but….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Queen of Wands can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. Remember, she can be fiery but life with her is never boring.
meaningsUpright.health: The Queen of Wands is a good omen as she represents health and vitality. Your energy levels should be high when she appears and people may wonder where you get your energy from.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Queen of Wands can show that you are full of energy at the moment on the work or business front and you are taking action and getting things done. Others may be astounded at the amount of tasks you are able to complete as you juggle many projects at once.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Queen of Wands shows that you desire new spiritual knowledge and practice when it appears. Your enthusiasm is commendable but make sure you put a bit of thought into your direction before deciding on the best course of action.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Queen of Wands reversed can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. If this is represents your partner, beware as she can signify deceitfulness, unfaithfulness and someone who is manipulative, jealous or spiteful.
meaningsReversed.health: The Queen of Wands reversed is not a good omen as she can represent ill-health and lack of vitality. Your energy levels may be low when she appears.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Queen of Wands reversed can show that you are lacking energy at the moment on the work or business front. There may be frustration at unexpected challenges or obstacles that is leaving you feeling unmotivated or exhausted when she appears.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Queen of Wands reversed shows that an older or mature female may try to control you on your spiritual journey. This woman may be a mentor or someone who offers you guidance but becomes overbearing and tries to force her own beliefs or practices on you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Queen of Wands reversed can show that you may be feeling pessimistic, temperamental or overwhelmed. You may have taken on far too many tasks and are trying to keep too many balls in the air when she appears. You may be exhausted and heading for burn out when she appears!

name: King of Wands
meaningUpright: King of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
meaningReversed: King of Wands reversed themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire
description: King of Wands upright themes: drive, creativity, initiative, fire. If you are in a relationship, the King of Wands can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. If this is your partner, bear i….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the King of Wands can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. If this is your partner, bear in mind that nothing will turn him off you quicker than you being clingy or needy.
meaningsUpright.health: The King of Wands is generally a good omen as it also shows good health and vitality. it does warn you not to forget to take time out to relax though to as you can be prone to overdoing it.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The King of Wands suggests that things will be going well on the work front. You should be motivated, energetic and action orientated when he appears.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the King of Wands shows that you are truly progressing on your spiritual path but don’t rush too far too fast. Remember Rome wasn’t built in a day so take some time to stop and smell the roses as this will be a lifelong journey of exploration and discovery.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the King of Wands reversed can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. If this is your partner, beware as the extreme negative of it can show an abusive relationship, a violent partner or a partner who is a womaniser.
meaningsReversed.health: The King of Wands reversed can show that you are overdoing and heading for a major burn out or that you are run down and tired with a low immune system. Try to be gentle with yourself and reduce the stress in your life.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The King of Wands reversed suggests that things may not be going well on the work front. You may be being too passive or unfocused.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the King of Wands reversed can show that you may be being very strict or rigid with yourself as you explore your spiritual development. Remember there is no rule that says you can’t be spiritual and have a good time.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the King of Wands reversed can show that you lack the energy, experience or enthusiasm to accomplish what you set out to achieve at this time. You are taking a back seat and are not being proactive in your life. You may feel that you are not up to the task or are giving away your power and setting a bad example for those who look up to you.

name: Four of Cups
meaningUpright: Four of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Four of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Four of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are single, the Four of Cups can show that you may be regretting past mistakes in the love department. It can show that you are so focused on what is missing in your love life or the relationships you’ve had that didn’t work out, that you are missing the oppo….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single, the Four of Cups can show that you may be regretting past mistakes in the love department. It can show that you are so focused on what is missing in your love life or the relationships you’ve had that didn’t work out, that you are missing the opportunities for love that are right in front of you.
meaningsUpright.health: The Four of Cups Tarot card can show that health issues have left you feeling depressed, weary or frustrated. You may be feeling sad about the restrictions your health woes are putting on you.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Four of Cups can show that you feel bored or unsatisfied in your career. You may feel like your career has become stagnant.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Four of Cups can show that you have been feeling disillusioned or are wishing your life away wondering what if. You need to let go of the regrets from your past and focus on the good things that are happening all around you.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are single, the Four of Cups Tarot card reversed can show that you are coming out a period of detachment or solitude where you were not interested in dating or starting a relationship. You may have withdrawn from the world due to the trauma of a bad breakup to give yourself time to heal.
meaningsReversed.health: The Four of Cups Tarot card in a reversed position shows you feeling re-energised and positive. Know that if health issues have been dragging you down, things are about to change.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Four of Cups reversed shows that you have been going through a period of stagnation in your career which is about to suddenly change. you be aware of the opportunities that are opening up to you.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Four of Cups reversed shows that you are ready to break out of the spiritual rut you’ve been in. You are ready to let go of the remorse, regrets and what ifs of the past and focus on the beauty and positivity that is all around you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Four of Cups Tarot card reversed shows that you are pulling yourself out of the rut you have been in. While your life may have previously felt stagnant, that is now coming to an end. The Four of Cups reversed represent leaving regrets, remorse and wishful thinking in the past and focusing on the present and moving forward in a positive direction.

name: Five of Cups
meaningUpright: Five of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Five of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Five of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are single, the Five of Cups can show that you are overcome with sadness or despair about a past relationship that did not work out. You may feel as though “The One” has slipped through your fingers and could be oblivious to potential partners as you are so focus….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single, the Five of Cups can show that you are overcome with sadness or despair about a past relationship that did not work out. You may feel as though “The One” has slipped through your fingers and could be oblivious to potential partners as you are so focused on your sense of loss.
meaningsUpright.health: The Five of Cups can show emotional baggage causing mental health issues. It can represent grief or sadness causing depression or your need to isolate yourself causing you panic attacks in social situations or agoraphobia.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Five of Cups can show a job loss or the collapse of a business. If you are in business it can also signify a business partner or staff member abandoning the company or it can signify you leaving the business or abandoning a business plan.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Five of Cups shows that you may be holding on to feelings of deep anger, frustration or resentment. As the saying goes, holding on to anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are single, the Five of Cups Tarot card in a reversed position can show that you have let go of your regrets or sorrow over your past relationships and are ready to move on. You are beginning to see the possibilities for romance that are all around you.
meaningsReversed.health: The Five of Cups reversed shows that allowing yourself to let go of past pain and opening up to positive healing energy will be key to resolving any health issues you are experiencing. If you are struggling to let go of negativity, some energy healing may be beneficial.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Five of Cups reversed can represent getting back on your feet after a job loss or redundancy. It can also represent beginning to rebuild a business after a loss or after being abandoned by a business partner.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Five of Cups reversed can show that you are coming out of a period of great loss or sorrow ready for a fresh start and new spiritual path. You have learned some important karmic lessons from the pain you’ve experienced and you’re allowing those experiences to make you a kinder, more spiritual and more empathetic person.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Five of Cups Tarot card reversed represents acceptance, forgiveness and healing. You have come to terms with your grief and sorrow. You have realised that living the rest of your life in regret, mourning or sadness will not change the past and have accepted that you have to move on with your life.

name: Six of Cups
meaningUpright: Six of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Six of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Six of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are in a relationship, the Six of Cups can simply indicate that you and your partner are childhood sweethearts. If the surrounding cards are positive, it can signify having children.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Six of Cups can simply indicate that you and your partner are childhood sweethearts. If the surrounding cards are positive, it can signify having children.
meaningsUpright.health: In a health reading, the Six of Cups can simply be telling you to be charitable or caring towards someone with ill health, they may need your support more than you know. It can also be an indication that a fast paced life may be causing you undue stress or illness, try to simplify your life as much as you can and get back to basics.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: In a career reading, the Six of Cups is generally a good omen. It signifies creativity, sharing and goodwill.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Six of Cups can show that you need to keep spiritual practices simple. Our spirituality an intrinsic part of who we are but sometimes in our eagerness to connect to spirit we can over-complicate things.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Six of Cups reversed can represent boredom or a lack of passion in the relationship. Although the relationship gives you security, you may be finding it stifling.
meaningsReversed.health: The Six of Cups reversed can be an indicator that any health issues you are suffering from may either be genetic or a physical manifestation of unresolved childhood issues/trauma. If you are planning a family, the Six of Cups in a reversed position can represent fertility issues or problems conceiving.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Six of Cups reversed can show that you are feeling bored in your current role or that it’s stifling your creativity. You may decide to leave the security and safety of this job to do something that you find creatively fulfilling.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Six of Cups reversed can show that now is a time to discover new beliefs and try new things rather than clinging rigidly to the beliefs or traditions you learned in childhood. Keep what works for you but don’t be afraid to branch out and incorporate new ideas that appeal to you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Six of Cups reversed can signify letting go of the past and being ready to move on to the future. It can be an indicator of growing up, becoming more mature or leaving home. It can also indicate letting go of childhood issues or childishness.

name: Seven of Cups
meaningUpright: Seven of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Seven of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Seven of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are single, the Seven of Cups shows that you have lots of potential partners interested in you and lots of opportunities for romance. If you are in a relationship, the Seven of Cups can show that a new potential love interest may appear and cause issues….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are single, the Seven of Cups shows that you have lots of potential partners interested in you and lots of opportunities for romance. If you are in a relationship, the Seven of Cups can show that a new potential love interest may appear and cause issues in your current relationship or cause you to question the relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Seven of Cups Tarot card can show that you may be overexerting yourself and taking on too many things at once which may be leaving you run down and susceptible to illness or injury. Try to reduce your workload to a manageable level and make time for yourself.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Seven of Cups is a good omen indicating that multiple possibilities for career advancement are open to you. Just be mindful of biting off more than you can chew.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Seven of Cups shows that you are exploring your spiritual side and there are many forms of spiritual practice that you are interested in. When is appears in a tarot reading, it can also indicate that you are ignoring your many spiritual gifts as you are not putting the work into developing them.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Seven of Cups reversed shows that you are starting to get a reality check about where your relationship is after a period of avoiding reality. You need to use this clarity to take stock of the relationship and take action to fix any issues that need to be resolved.
meaningsReversed.health: The Seven of Cups reversed can represent poor lifestyle choices having a negative effect on health. If you have been overindulging or binging on food, alcohol or drugs for instance, the Seven of Cups reversed tells you it’s time to get back your control.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Seven of Cups reversed can show that you may be feeling trapped in your career or that your opportunities for advancement are restricted. Perhaps you feel that you’ve missed out on the perfect job as you weren’t focused enough on your goals in the past.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Seven of Cups reversed shows that you are neglecting your spiritual side and are overly focused on the superficial or materialistic elements of life. Materialistic pursuits will not bring you true contentment.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Seven of Cups Tarot card reversed can show that you are finding clarity and getting back to reality after a period of indulging in fantasies or living in a dream world. You may be finally starting to act decisively and to see the correct path for you clearly, having previously felt indecisive or lost. It represents getting a reality check.

name: Eight of Cups
meaningUpright: Eight of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Eight of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Eight of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. The Eight of Cups is not a great omen in a love or relationship Tarot spread. It represents abandonment or abandonment issues.

meaningsUpright.love: The Eight of Cups is not a great omen in a love or relationship Tarot spread. It represents abandonment or abandonment issues.
meaningsUpright.health: The Eight of Cups shows that you may be spending too much time dwelling on the negative things in your life which could be having a negative impact on your health. Try to shift your focus as a positive outlook may help your health improve.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Eight of Cups can show that you may walk away from a job that you no longer find fulfilling. You may be feeling like you are not on the correct career path and may be considering a complete career change.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Eight of Cups shows that you may be taking a voyage of self-discovery. You could find yourself doing a lot of soul-searching and introspection when this Minor Arcana card appears.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Eight of Cups reversed can show that you may be unhappy in your relationship but unwilling to let it go for fear of being alone. You may be doing a great job of appearing to the outside world to be happy in your relationship while on the inside things have become monotonous and stagnant.
meaningsReversed.health: The Eight of Cups reversed can be an indicator that you are keeping yourself in a situation that is having a negative impact on your health. You need to evaluate what is impacting your health and what you can do to improve things.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Eight of Cups reversed shows that your career may have become stagnant and unfulfilling to you but you are sticking with it because you are afraid to change. You may have not explored all the options available to you, instead choosing to accept your lot in life.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, when the Eight of Cups reversed appears in a Tarot reading, it shows that you may be lacking in self-awareness or your spiritual growth may be stunted at the moment. You may need to do some soul-searching to connect with your spiritual self and discover your true life path.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Eight of Cups reversed can show stagnation. When it appears you may be accepting your lot in life or staying in bad situation that makes you terribly unhappy because you are afraid of moving on or worried about what the future might hold if you leave. You may appear happy to those around you but underneath it all you know you need to get let go of certain people or situations in your life in order to move forward.

name: Nine of Cups
meaningUpright: Nine of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Nine of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Nine of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are in a relationship, the Nine of Cups is a good omen indicating that the relationship is in a good place. You should be feeling happy and fulfilled with your partner when it appears.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Nine of Cups is a good omen indicating that the relationship is in a good place. You should be feeling happy and fulfilled with your partner when it appears.
meaningsUpright.health: The Nine of Cups is a positive omen, so if you have been suffering from health issues you should see some improvement or be feeling more positive about your health when it appears in a reading. If your health is good, it shows that it should stay that way.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: Things should be going great with the Nine of Cups in your career Tarot reading! It is a card of success, achievement and acclaim so whatever projects you are involved in should not only be going well but your success will get you noticed!
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Nine of Cups shows that you be feeling happy and fulfilled on many levels and you be emanating positive energy and love to those around you.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Nine of Cups reversed is not a good omen as it can show that the relationship is not in a good place and that one or both of you is feeling let down or disappointed with it. To the outside world, it may look like everything is fine but on the inside there may be unhappiness and lack of fulfilment.
meaningsReversed.health: The Nine of Cups reversed can be an indicator of eating disorders such as anorexia or bulimia, over eating or excessive indulgence and addictions. If you are suffering from any of these you may need professional medical assistance and or counselling to help you to get to the root causes of these issues and to overcome them.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Nine of Cups reversed can show that your dream job or business may have turned into something of a nightmare. Maybe you have started your own business or landed the promotion you wanted but now find that it is not as fulfilling as you thought it would be or the workload is making you miserable.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Nine of Cups reversed can show that you may be feeling a lack of spiritual fulfilment and looking for external ways of filling this void. True fulfilment comes from within so you would do well to shift your focus back to your spiritual side and concentrate on discovering your spiritual path.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Nine of Cups reversed is not a great omen as it can represent shattered dreams or wishes turning into nightmares. You may have gotten what you wanted but now find that it’s not how you hoped it would be. Alternately, you may have gotten what you wanted and subsequently lost it and are now feeling the devastation that can bring.

name: Ten of Cups
meaningUpright: Ten of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Ten of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Ten of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are married, the Ten of Cups is a great omen for long term relationships and marriage and it is a soulmate card so things should be going very well when it appears. It represents a happy and harmonious relationship.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are married, the Ten of Cups is a great omen for long term relationships and marriage and it is a soulmate card so things should be going very well when it appears. It represents a happy and harmonious relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have made some changes to improve your health, the Ten of Cups tells you that you soon start to feel the benefits. If you haven’t made those changes, start now.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Ten of Cups is a good omen. It shows that things should be going well in work as you should have reached a point where you are reaping the rewards of your hard work.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ten of Cups shows that you be feeling very happy and positive. Those around you also feel the benefits of the good energy radiating from you.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Ten of Cups reversed is not a great omen in a love Tarot reading. It can show a rocky relationship and can be an indicator of one partner not wanting commitment, marriage or children.
meaningsReversed.health: The Ten of Cups reversed can show a lack of harmony within the body so try to keep a balanced diet and when it appears. There may be unexpected health issues or surgery with it.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: In a career reading, the Ten of Cups reversed can simply indicate a career in social work or working with families. It can also indicate a lack of team work or feeling isolated in a work environment.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ten of Cups reversed can show that you are not sticking to your own personal moral code in some way. You need to be true to yourself and follow your spiritual path in order to find true fulfilment.

descriptionReversed: In a general Tarot reading, the Ten of Cups Tarot card reversed is not a great omen. The love, harmony and contentment have disappeared and are replaced with discontent, arguments and conflict. The Ten of Cups reversed can generally refer to an unhappy home life, broken home or dysfunctional family situation.

name: Page of Cups
meaningUpright: Page of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Page of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Page of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are in a relationship, the Page of Cups is a good omen as it can represent the possibility of romantic proposals, engagements, pregnancies, marriages or births. It can also suggest that you need to be more romantic and be willing to be a follow your heart.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Page of Cups is a good omen as it can represent the possibility of romantic proposals, engagements, pregnancies, marriages or births. It can also suggest that you need to be more romantic and be willing to be a follow your heart.
meaningsUpright.health: In a health reading, the Page of Cups is usually the bearer of positive news. This could be in the form of a test coming back with the result you want, or getting a diagnosis that will clarify things and allow you to take positive steps to improve your health or even receiving information about a treatment which will help you.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: If you have been waiting on word about a promotion or job application the Page of Cups is a good omen indicating happy news. The Page of Cups can also represent being a dreamer rather than a doer.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Page of Cups is a great card to get as it can show emerging intuition or psychic abilities. You may find that spirit is sending you some very positive messages when it appears.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Page of Cups reversed can show disappointment in love, cancelled engagements, heartbreak or breakups. It can also be an indicator that you may have become overly sensitive or high maintenance or that childishness or drama queen type behaviour may be causing friction in your relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: The Page of Cups reversed can be an indicator that you may be engaging in behaviour that could be very detrimental to your health such as drug or alcohol abuse. Seek professional help to stop if you need to.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: If you are waiting for news on a job application or promotion, the Page of Cups reversed can show that you may not get the news you hoped for. Alternately, if you have not been acting with integrity in your workplace, it may come back to bite you.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Page of Cups reversed can be an indication that you are becoming so engrossed in the spirit realm that you are losing your grip on the physical world and forgetting to live! This may take the form of neglecting important material matters to focus on spiritual pursuits, excessive meditation or ritualistic practice or becoming overly dependent on psychic readings.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Page of Cups reversed is not a great omen as it can bring bad news. For instance, you could find you fall in love with someone who does not return your feelings or you may find that a social event you have been looking forward to is cancelled. Whatever form this news takes it could possibly cause sadness, disappointment, heartbreak or sorrow.

name: Knight of Cups
meaningUpright: Knight of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Knight of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
