description: Knight of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. Whether you are single or in a relationship, the Knight of Cups is a great omen to get in a love Tarot spread. If you are single, the Knight of Cups can show that you are about to be swept off your feet.

meaningsUpright.love: Whether you are single or in a relationship, the Knight of Cups is a great omen to get in a love Tarot spread. If you are single, the Knight of Cups can show that you are about to be swept off your feet.
meaningsUpright.health: In a health reading, the Knight of Cups shows that your health should be on the up. It is generally a good omen if you are waiting for tests results that the results should be positive or at least better than expected.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Knight of Cups represents good news or a positive offer. If you are waiting on news about a job or course application, this Knight can represent being successful.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Knight of Cups is an indicator of messages coming to you from spirit so pay attention to the synchronicities all around you. If you are seeking to develop your psychic abilities it is a very good omen.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Knight of Cups reversed is not a good omen as it can show the end of a relationship, a broken engagement or a romantic proposal of some sort being revoked. The negative aspects of the reversed Knight of Cups can take many forms: a partner who turns from happy and committed to suddenly commitment-phobic, a partner who is a heartbreaker or cheater or a partner who becomes obsessive, abusive or misogynistic.
meaningsReversed.health: The reversed Knight of Cups can be an indication of drug or alcohol abuse negatively affecting someone’s health. It can also be an indication that a hectic lifestyle may be having a bigger impact on your health than you realise.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Knight of Cups reversed is not a good omen as it can represent bad news, missed opportunities through procrastination or revoked/withdrawn offers. If you are waiting on news about a job or course application, this Minor Arcana card can represent being unsuccessful or offers falling through.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the reversed Knight of Cups can show blocked psychic gifts. Perhaps you are so busy that you are missing the messages spirit is trying to send you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Knight of Cups reversed Tarot card can represent revoked offers or proposals, bad news and withdrawn invitations. The news this Minor Arcana brings usually brings with it heartbreak, sorrow or disappointment. The Knight of Cups reversed Tarot card can be telling you not to jump to conclusions or to check your facts before taking action.

name: Queen of Cups
meaningUpright: Queen of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: Queen of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: Queen of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are in a relationship, the Queen of Cups can show a time of caring, fulfilment and emotional security in the relationship. it can also indicate that you need to be open and honest about your feelings to get the best outcome for your relationship.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Queen of Cups can show a time of caring, fulfilment and emotional security in the relationship. it can also indicate that you need to be open and honest about your feelings to get the best outcome for your relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Queen of Cups can show caring or support being offered to you. This can in some cases be a sign that you require support in order to deal with an injury or illness.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Queen of Cups can be an indication that you need to consider if your current career is fulfilling your emotional as well as material needs. it can show that you would be suited to a career in a caring profession such as nursing, counselling or healing or a creative field such as art or fashion.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Queen of Cups signifies strong intuition or psychic abilities. If you are seeking to develop your psychic abilities it is a great omen to get as she shows a big increase in psychic powers.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Queen of Cups reversed can be a warning not to let your insecurities or lack of trust affect your relationship. If you have been acting clingy or needy you need to get back control of your emotions before you push your partner away.
meaningsReversed.health: The Queen of Cups reversed can show that you may be extending yourself too much to the detriment of your health. Try to take time out for yourself and find the balance you need.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Queen of Cups reversed can be an indication that you may be feeling overly emotional or sensitive to other people’s moods which could be causing you stress in work. It can also be an indication that you are giving too much of yourself to your work or becoming disorganised and not managing your time properly, leaving you exhausted or drained.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Queen of Cups reversed can signify blocked intuition or psychic abilities not being used to their potential. If you are seeking to develop your psychic abilities it tells you to slow down, your psychic abilities will develop in their own time.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Queen of Cups reversed Tarot card generally shows emotional immaturity. She can also indicate that you may be feeling overly sensitive, insecure, depressed or sulky. This Minor Arcana card reversed warns you to avoid becoming bitter or vengeful if things do not go your way.

name: King of Cups
meaningUpright: King of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
meaningReversed: King of Cups reversed themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water
description: King of Cups upright themes: emotion, relationships, intuition, water. If you are in a relationship, the King of Cups can be a very good omen as it is the good husband, partner or father card. It is a very loving card so you should be finding a lot of emotional fulfilment when it appears and petty arguments should be at a minimum.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the King of Cups can be a very good omen as it is the good husband, partner or father card. It is a very loving card so you should be finding a lot of emotional fulfilment when it appears and petty arguments should be at a minimum.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been ill the King of Cups can show healing and as such, is a positive card to get. It reminds you to treat yourself with empathy and kindness.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: In terms of career, the King of Cups can show that an older male may offer you support or guidance in a career context. It can also be an indication that you find your diplomacy skills and wisdom to resolve any career issues and create a pleasant working environment for yourself.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the King of Cups signifies a highly developed psychic or intuitive ability and is a great card to get in a spiritual Tarot spread. This Minor Arcana tells you that you be receiving and understanding the messages spirit is sending you and using them to help others.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in relationship, the King of Cups reversed is not a great card to get as it can show you or your partner becoming emotionally unstable and cause problems in the relationship. One of you may be going through a tough time emotionally and may not be treating the other with the love and kindness they deserve.
meaningsReversed.health: In a health reading, the King of Cups reversed can show alcohol or drug abuse issues as the emotionally overwhelmed King turns to vices as a coping mechanism. It is generally an indication that something in your lifestyle or environment is negatively affecting your health and well-being.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The King of Cups reversed can show that you may have to deal with a ruthless, cold or emotionally unstable male in your workplace. This person will stop at nothing to get what they want and can be prone to emotional tirades if they don’t get it.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the King of Cups reversed can show that simply indicate that your psychic abilities or intuition has become blocked. However, it can also signify that you are using your powers in the wrong way.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the King of Cups reversed can represent being overly emotional or too sensitive. It can signify a lack of emotional maturity. It can be a sign that you are lacking back bone or are allowing yourself to be too gullible or putting yourself in a position where others can take advantage of you.

name: Four of Swords
meaningUpright: Four of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Four of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Four of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Four of Swords can show that you and your partner are taking time out to rest, regroup and reconnect in your relationship. Fear, anxiety and stress have left you and your partner feeling in need of some peace and quiet.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Four of Swords can show that you and your partner are taking time out to rest, regroup and reconnect in your relationship. Fear, anxiety and stress have left you and your partner feeling in need of some peace and quiet.
meaningsUpright.health: The Four of Swords can show that you need rest or recuperation as such it can be indicative of being hospitalised. it can show that anxiety related illnesses may be exasperated at this time, try to take some time out to relax and reboot.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Four of Swords shows that you are really feeling the pressure in work! Stress and worries are overwhelming you and leading to mental overload.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Four of Swords can show that you may be in need of solitude or sanctuary. You need to slow down and listen to your inner wisdom.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Four of Swords reversed can show that your relationship is slowly recovering after a difficult period. Alternatively, it can show that the stress and anxiety you and your partner are experiencing has spiralled and is pushing your relationship to breaking point.
meaningsReversed.health: The Four of Swords reversed can either indicate healing and recovery after a period of poor mental or physical health or it can show pushing yourself so far or not taking care of yourself to the point that you burn out! It can also indicate a mental or nervous breakdown.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Four of Swords reversed can show that you may be going back to work after a break, illness or other period of time off. You may have needed to take this time off to get your stress levels under control and now you feel able to manage your work and work environment.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Four of Swords reversed can show that you have lost your faith or are experiencing some sort of spiritual crisis brought about by fear and anxiety. You may have been offered spiritual counselling or support but have rejected it when it appears.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Four of Swords reversed represents awakening and finding mental strength. you be coming out of isolation after a period of solitude or mental overload and re-joining the world. This Minor Arcana tells you that you are slowly recovering and that healing is possible.

name: Five of Swords
meaningUpright: Five of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Five of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Five of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Five of Swords is not a great omen as it can show arguments, hostility and serious conflict arising due to a lack of communication. It is also a Minor Arcana card of deception and self-sabotaging behaviour so infidelity and cheating can….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Five of Swords is not a great omen as it can show arguments, hostility and serious conflict arising due to a lack of communication. It is also a Minor Arcana card of deception and self-sabotaging behaviour so infidelity and cheating can be signified by it.
meaningsUpright.health: The Five of Swords shows that you a likely to be feeling battle weary at the moment in terms of health. Whether it is stress, anxiety or a recent illness, the challenges you have been through or a currently going through have drained your energy.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Five of Swords shows that there is conflict in the work place. Expect stress, tension, arguments and hostility caused by poor communication or a complete lack of communication when this Minor Arcana card appears in your career Tarot spread.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Five of Swords shows that the challenges you have overcome have given you the wisdom, strength and empathy to heal others. it also shows change so you may find yourself pursuing a new spiritual path when it appears.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Five of Swords reversed can show that you and your partner may be putting an end to some conflict in your relationship, learning to compromise and overcoming challenges. You may be letting bygones be bygones in respect of any arguments or issues you have been having and learning to communicate with each other but be aware, this peace requires work to make it last.
meaningsReversed.health: The Five of Swords reversed shows suggests that you find a way to resolve an ongoing or recurring health issue that has been a problem for you. It shows that a compromise or sacrifice needs to be made to bring this about, for example you may find that you are allergic to a food you love and have to give it up or you may find that you have to adjust your fitness regime to compensate for an injury but a solution is possible.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Five of Swords reversed shows that a conflict in the workplace may be coming to an end. Tensions may be being released, compromises made and a peaceful resolution is now possible as lines of communication open up when this Minor Arcana card appears in your career Tarot spread.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Five of Swords reversed can show that you have overcome a major hurdle in relation to your spiritual path and that this may have required a major sacrifice on your part, for example parting way with an old belief system and letting go of some traditions that you were used to. You are now in a position to move in a spiritual direction that works for you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Five of Swords reversed can be a good omen as it can signify the peaceful resolution of a situation, ending conflict and moving on. It is a Minor Arcana card of communication, compromise, overcoming challenges and releasing stress. However, the Five of Swords Tarot card reversed can signify an escalation in serious violence and revenge.

name: Six of Swords
meaningUpright: Six of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Six of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Six of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Six of Swords shows that your relationship is moving into calmer waters after a difficult period. Healing, stability and open communication are all coming to the fore now and it is a positive time where the relationship can progress.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Six of Swords shows that your relationship is moving into calmer waters after a difficult period. Healing, stability and open communication are all coming to the fore now and it is a positive time where the relationship can progress.
meaningsUpright.health: The Six of Swords can show an acute illness being brought under control or relief of symptoms and as such, it generally a good card to get. You may still be feeling lethargic or drained when it appears as recent events have taken their toll but things should be moving in the right direction so stay positive.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Six of Swords signifies that things on the work front are calming down. You may be moving into an easier phase in your work life where things are under control, you are accomplishing your goals and completing tasks with ease or you may have moved to a job that is much better for you.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Six of Swords tells you that your spirit guides are all around you guiding you to the wisdom you are seeking. Pay attention to your intuition, visions and dreams at this time as they are trying to tell you something important.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Six of Swords reversed shows that your relationship is stormy at the moment and you are going through a rough patch or a troubled period. You may be feeling overwhelmed, trapped or stuck or the relationship may not be progressing as quickly as you would like.
meaningsReversed.health: The Six of Swords reversed can show that recovery from illness or injury will take longer than you hope or anticipate. There may be delays in healing or setbacks and you may feel like your health is up in air at the moment.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Six of Swords reversed signifies that things on the work front are turbulent. Someone may be trying to cause trouble for you in the workplace or you may feel trapped in a job you don’t like.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Six of Swords reversed shows that you may be having issues with sensing your spirit guides or experiencing delays in your progression on you spiritual path, leaving you feeling stuck or frustrated. Try to relax and know that your abilities will progress at the pace they are meant to, there will be times when you progress quickly and other times less so, it is all part of a greater plan for you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Six of Swords reversed represents moving into troubled waters, lack of progress and jumping out of the frying pan and into the fire. In a reversed position, it is a Minor Arcana card of feeling stuck, trapped overwhelmed, restricted and having nowhere to run or choosing to stand your ground. it signifies instability, rocking the boat, causing trouble and stormy relationships so you can expect life to be a little turbulent when it appears.

name: Seven of Swords
meaningUpright: Seven of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Seven of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Seven of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Seven of Swords is not a great omen as it can show deception, betrayal, lies and cheating. This may be a sign of infidelity in the relationship.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Seven of Swords is not a great omen as it can show deception, betrayal, lies and cheating. This may be a sign of infidelity in the relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Seven of Swords can show that you may need further testing to get to the bottom of a health issue. If your symptoms have been ignored or dismissed by your health practitioner but persist anyway, it might be advisable to get second opinion as it can show that the cause of your symptoms may be escaping detection.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Seven of Swords can show that there is some deceit or trickery around you in a work setting. Colleagues may be trying to undermine you, spreading lies behind your back or stealing your projects or your business associates may be involved in dodgy deals.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Seven of Swords warns you of deception. This deception may appear in the form of associates, teachers or religious leaders who may be underhanded or deceitful in their dealings with you, do not allow yourself to be manipulated.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Seven of Swords reversed is not a great omen as although the card has reversed it usually still shows that there has been deception or cheating in the relationship. This deception will be exposed and truth will come out but it can show a number of scenarios in the circumstances that bring this about.
meaningsReversed.health: The Seven of Swords reversed shows that you may be ignoring warning signs in relation to your health. This self-deception will not do you any favours and could make an illness worse so be mindful of the messages your body is giving you and take appropriate action.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Seven of Swords reversed shows that if you have been deceitful or underhanded in your work your conscience may kick in and you may decide to confess or you may be exposed. This Minor Arcana card reversed may be indication of others in your work environment being extremely two faced or deceitful and being exposed as such.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Seven of Swords reversed tells you that someone may be trying to offer you spiritual guidance at this time but just be sure you only take what works for you and throw the rest away. While the wisdom they depart may be useful to you, there may still be an ulterior motive in play that you are unaware of.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Seven of Swords reversed signifies coming clean and one’s conscience kicking in so if you have done something you are not proud of you may find yourself confessing and turning over a new leaf. It can represent careers in the military or security. Alternatively, this Minor Arcana card reversed represents pathological liars, serial cheaters, people who are malicious or so two faced they are toxic or dangerous to be around.

name: Eight of Swords
meaningUpright: Eight of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Eight of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Eight of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Eight of Swords is not a great omen as it can represent feeling trapped, confined or backed into a corner in your relationship. You may be feeling like you cannot escape but that is only your perception!.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Eight of Swords is not a great omen as it can represent feeling trapped, confined or backed into a corner in your relationship. You may be feeling like you cannot escape but that is only your perception!
meaningsUpright.health: The Eight of Swords can in some cases be an indication of mental health and anxiety disorders such as PTSD, agoraphobia, depression or panic attacks. However, it is also the card of major weight-loss so if you are trying to lose some weight it is a very welcome card to get!
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Eight of Swords suggests that you are feeling trapped in your career or current position. You may be feeling powerless, hopeless and helpless to improve you situation at the moment but you are the master of your own destiny.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Eight of Swords tells you not to allow yourself to be restricted. You may be feeling powerless when it appears, this can take the form of feeling trapped in your life or confined to a religion or spiritual path.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Eight of Swords reversed can represent releasing your fears or anxiety regarding your relationship and overcoming obstacles so it can be a good omen if you have been experience anxiety about the relationship. If you have been in an unhappy or abusive relationship where you felt trapped, it would suggest that you escape the relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: The Eight of Swords reversed can represent recovering from or overcoming mental health and anxiety disorders such as PTSD, agoraphobia, depression or panic attacks. It can also signify successful treatment of eye issues.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Eight of Swords reversed can show that you may have learned to release you stress, anxiety and fear in relation to work and you should be having a much easier time in work. It can also signify that you may have left a job or career path that had been restricting your potential or making you feel trapped.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Eight of Swords reversed tells you that you be feeling empowered, hopeful and free to explore you spiritual path when it appears.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Eight of Swords reversed can represent release, freedom, escape and finding solutions and options. It signifies relieving pressure, releasing anxiety and facing fears and truths. When reversed, it is a Minor Arcana card of self-belief, ignoring criticism, standing up to abuse and taking back control.

name: Nine of Swords
meaningUpright: Nine of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Nine of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Nine of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Nine of Swords shows that your relationship is not a happy one at the moment. This Minor Arcana card signifies guilt, remorse and regret so it can be sign that keeping secrets, infidelity or deception is taking its toll on the relationsh….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Nine of Swords shows that your relationship is not a happy one at the moment. This Minor Arcana card signifies guilt, remorse and regret so it can be sign that keeping secrets, infidelity or deception is taking its toll on the relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Nine of Swords can signify anxiety disorders, mental health issues, insomnia and migraines. If you are struggling to cope, again it shows that you need to find healthy ways of managing your stress and anxiety.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Nine of Swords suggests that you are deeply unhappy in your work at the moment. The stress and burdens of your work are overwhelming you.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Nine of Swords shows that the anxiety and stress you are experiencing at the moment has left you feeling overwhelmed, ungrounded and out of touch with your spiritual side. Reiki, grounding exercises or meditation would be beneficial to you right now to help you to get back in touch with your spirituality and bring you back into balance.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Nine of Swords reversed can show that if there has been infidelity or deception in the relationship it will now come to light. If you have cheated on your partner you may have come clean or been caught out as it can show a scandal and extreme remorse, regret, guilt or shame.
meaningsReversed.health: The Nine of Swords reversed can represent overcoming depression, anxiety or fear related mental health issues and feeling able to cope with life again after such issues. Alternatively, as a reversed card it can signify an escalation in such issues, representing psychosis, hallucinations and extreme night terrors.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Nine of Swords reversed suggests that the stress and burdens of your work either get better or worsen. You may have found a way to release your worries and realise that your career is not as bad as you thought.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Nine of Swords reversed can show that you have overcome the darkness and once again can see the light at the end of the tunnel. Alternatively, it can signify that you are in an extremely dark place and are being far too hard on yourself.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Nine of Swords reversed represents seeing the light at the end of the tunnel after dark times. When reversed, it is a Minor Arcana card of recovering from depression or mental illness or issues improving, letting go of negativity, releasing stress and learning to cope. It signifies opening up, accepting help and facing life.

name: Ten of Swords
meaningUpright: Ten of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Ten of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Ten of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Ten of Swords is not a great omen as it shows breakups, divorce, separation, bitterness or severing ties. If it relates to a breakup, you probably already be aware that the relationship is in serious trouble.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Ten of Swords is not a great omen as it shows breakups, divorce, separation, bitterness or severing ties. If it relates to a breakup, you probably already be aware that the relationship is in serious trouble.
meaningsUpright.health: The Ten of Swords is not a great omen as it shows that you have hit a wall and you need to stop and deal with your health. Chronic fatigue, exhaustion, collapse and even nervous breakdowns are all represented by it.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Ten of Swords is not a good omen, it can show that you have hit a dead end in your job or that your time in your current role may be ending and you may be severing ties. It can also signify that you be the subject of people badmouthing you and backstabbing or bitching behind your back so keep your ears open and be on the lookout for colleagues trying to undermine you.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ten of Swords usually shows that you may be severing ties with an old belief system. It can also be a warning to be on the lookout for people in your spiritual circle that may be disloyal or dangerous as it can show curses or betrayal.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Ten of Swords reversed can show a relationship coming back from the brink of failure or collapsing completely and being beyond repair. If you are in an abusive relationship, the Ten of Swords reversed can suggest that you escape the relationship, be aware that it can show an extreme escalation in the abuse.
meaningsReversed.health: The Ten of Swords reversed can show health improving and surviving a serious illness or disease. However, it can also represent a near death experience, inability to survive and suicidal thoughts overwhelming you so look to supporting cards for confirmation.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Ten of Swords reversed can show that you gotten over the worst of the stress in your job or have severed ties with a job that was pushing you to the brink of a collapse. Alternatively, it can show that a terrible work situation is pushing you over the edge.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ten of Swords reversed usually shows that you come through past hardships and learned lessons from them that you bring forward on your journey through life. You may have gained a lot of wisdom and empathy for others from these experiences.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Ten of Swords reversed can represent things getting better, getting over the worst, surviving/ being saved from disaster and escaping ruin. It is a Minor Arcana reversed card of pulling yourself together and learning from past hardships. It can signify something coming back from the brink of death or failure, Near Death Experiences and Out of Body Experiences.

name: Page of Swords
meaningUpright: Page of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Page of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Page of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Page of Swords can show that there may be some conflict in your relationship as you allow yourself to be drawn into unnecessary or petty arguments with your partner. By all means fight your corner over the important things, but don’t al….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Page of Swords can show that there may be some conflict in your relationship as you allow yourself to be drawn into unnecessary or petty arguments with your partner. By all means fight your corner over the important things, but don’t allow every tiny disagreement to spiral in to a full blown argument.
meaningsUpright.health: The Page of Swords shows that you have an opportunity to heal from any past illness or injuries as it brings you the mental clarity to overcome any challenges you face. be mindful not to overdo it though!
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Page of Swords shows that you are highly intelligent and ambitious and are full of innovative, bright ideas. You may be dreaming of an incredibly successful career when it appears.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Page of Swords shows that you may have been neglecting your spiritual side in favour of the more logical side of life. There is a place for logic and reason in your life but your spiritual side needs a place too.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Page of Swords reversed can show that your partner may be playing mind games, be cold or uncaring in their treatment of you or bringing emotional baggage from a previous relationship into your relationship which is causing conflict or making them paranoid. Do not allow your partner to punish you for the treatment they received from a past partner.
meaningsReversed.health: The Page of Swords reversed that you may be suffering with mental health issues or may be feeling mentally scattered, foggy or confused. You are trying to do too much at once.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Page of Swords reversed can show that you cannot make your mind up when it comes to career. You may find yourself jumping from industry to industry or project to project unable to decide on the right career path for you.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Page of Swords reversed warns you to beware of those who may use their sharp wit to manipulate you. They make appear in the form of spiritual leaders to act as though they know everything.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Page of Swords reversed can represent bad or disappointing news and lack of ideas, planning or inspiration. It can also signify being defensive, cold, vindictive, cynical or sarcastic. This Minor Arcana card reversed may be telling you to get your head out of the clouds and can represent acting in a scatter-brained or dim-witted manner.

name: Knight of Swords
meaningUpright: Knight of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Knight of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Knight of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Knight of Swords can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. It can also indicate that a c….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Knight of Swords can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. It can also indicate that a change you have been waiting for is imminent and you need to jump in with both feet, this could take the form of a deeper commitment or a marriage proposal or romantic proposal.
meaningsUpright.health: The Knight of Swords can represent good news and an upswing in health. If you have been struggling with an illness or injury, it can show that a positive change is coming, one that you may have been hoping for.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Knight of Swords represents ambition, drive and determination. You know what you want to achieve and you are going for it.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Knight of Swords again speaks to a big change coming. A moment in your life when many elements come together at the right time and place as the universe hands you an opportunity to advance on your path and embrace your destiny, jump at the chance when it comes!

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Knight of Swords reversed can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. be mindful if this is representing your partner as it can show that they are controlling, abusive, aggressive, violent or dangerous.
meaningsReversed.health: The Knight of Swords reversed can represent disappointing news. If you have been struggling with an illness or injury, this reversed card can show that you may feel frustrated or impatient with rate at which you are recovering or healing.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Knight of Swords reversed can show that you may be feeling out of your depth in your work life at the moment. Perhaps you’ve been thrown in at the deep end with a project and are struggling to find your feet.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Knight of Swords reversed may be telling you to slow down and allow yourself to adjust to any changes that are happening for you on a spiritual front. Or it may be telling you that you have a missed an opportunity to seize your destiny.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Knight of Swords reversed can show that a big change or opportunity that you have been awaiting for quite some has come your way but you are failing recognise or seize it. It may be that you are not ready to jump on or that you are out of your depth. Whatever the case, it tells you that if you miss this opportunity you get left behind.

name: Queen of Swords
meaningUpright: Queen of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: Queen of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: Queen of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the Queen of Swords can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. As a partner, she likes her ow….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the Queen of Swords can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. As a partner, she likes her own space and is extremely discerning about the people she dates or has relationships with.
meaningsUpright.health: The Queen of Swords shows that repressed emotions may be at the root of any health issues you are experiencing. You may have suppressed sadness or grief.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Queen of Swords can show that you may receive support, assistance or constructive criticism from an older woman in your work environment. This woman is sophisticated, honest, wise and professional.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Queen of Swords can show that you are trying to rationalise things too much rather than follow your emotions and intuition and this is delaying your progress on your spiritual path as your mind wrestles with your heart. Your emotions and your intuition are just as important as your rational brain, don’t disregard them.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the Queen of Swords reversed can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. The Queen of Swords can simply represent a woman who is in a relationship but is fearful of being single or alternatively, feels her freedom is far too restricted.
meaningsReversed.health: The Queen of Swords reversed shows that at the moment you are a bit scatter-brained when it comes to your health. This may take the form of forgetting to go for appointments, not taking medication as instructed or not following through on treatment plans.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Queen of Swords reversed can represent an older woman in work environment who is overly critical or harsh with you or may spread malicious gossip about you. However, this Minor Arcana card can also point to communication issues where you may not be getting your point across in the best way.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Queen of Swords reversed can show that you are completely shutting off your intuition and emotions in favour of your rational thought. On the flip side, it can mean that you have completely switched to going on emotions and gut instincts against any rational thought.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Queen of Swords reversed can represent not learning from the past or not forgiving the past and using it as a stick to beat others around you with. it can signify that an older or mature female in your life may try to drag you down by spreading malicious gossip about you or being overly critical of you. It can also be an indication that you are feeling dependent on others or not getting the freedom and independence you crave.

name: King of Swords
meaningUpright: King of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
meaningReversed: King of Swords reversed themes: thought, clarity, truth, air
description: King of Swords upright themes: thought, clarity, truth, air. If you are in a relationship the King of Swords can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. It can also indicate that you a….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship the King of Swords can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. It can also indicate that you and your partner are connected on an intellectual level as well as a physical and emotional level.
meaningsUpright.health: The King of Swords shows that putting more structure into your routine is the key to maintaining or improving your health or fitness right now and in the future. This may take the form of going to bed at a set time, eating set meals, working out in a more structured way such as taking an exercise class or getting a personal trainer.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The King of Swords can represent a mature older man in your work environment who will challenge you and hold you to high standards. He may be stern with you but don’t be overly sensitive.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the King of Swords tells you that you can learn about as many spiritual practices as you like, attend as many workshops as are available, read as many books as you can get your hands on but at some point you just need to start putting all your knowledge into practice and follow your heart instead of your head. Now is that time, stop thinking it and start doing it!

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship the King of Swords reversed can show that you are in a relationship with someone who embodies the qualities outlined in the above section or you are displaying some of those characteristics yourself in your love life. If it represents your partner you need to be very cautious.
meaningsReversed.health: The King of Swords reversed can show that you feel powerless at the moment. If you are going through medical treatment, you may feel like the medical professionals you are dealing with are making all the calls or not listening to your thoughts on the best course of treatment.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The King of Swords reversed can represent a mature older man in your work environment who may be intimidating you or even bullying you. He may be power hungry, judgemental, cold and aggressive and may try to use his intelligence and authority to try and undermine you.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the King of Swords reversed shows that you need to keep your head engaged in your spiritual development. You need to use your head to filter out the useful bits from the huge volume of information that is coming your way.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the King of Swords reversed can represent lack of structure, routine, self-discipline, power or authority. When reversed it is a Minor Arcana card of not using your head or losing your cool. Alternatively, it can represent being power hungry, inhumane or a tyrant.

name: Four of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Four of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Four of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Four of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. The Four of Pentacles is not a great card to get. If you are in a relationship, it can show that either you or your partner may be acting in a possessive, jealous or controlling manner which could be having a negative effect on your relationship.

meaningsUpright.love: The Four of Pentacles is not a great card to get. If you are in a relationship, it can show that either you or your partner may be acting in a possessive, jealous or controlling manner which could be having a negative effect on your relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Four of Pentacles can show that you may be holding on to old negative energy from past issues or experiences that may be having a knock on effect on your health. It might be a good idea to try Reiki or some form of energy healing to help you release those energies.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: In a career spread, the Four of Pentacles usually shows that you are in a stable position in your career. Do not let fear of losing that position rule your life, you can be mindful about maintaining your position without being paranoid or isolating yourself.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Four of Pentacles shows that you may be holding onto the past and resisting going forward on your spiritual path. Fear, regret or negativity may be holding you back and you may be closing your heart off to others or focusing too much on materialism.

meaningsReversed.love: The Four of Pentacles reversed is a good omen. If you are in a relationship, it can show that you are letting go of fear and resentment in order to allow your relationship to move forward in a positive way.
meaningsReversed.health: The Four of Pentacles reversed shows that you are releasing or are ready to release the negative energy you have been holding onto and move forward in a positive, healthy way. Maybe you have been suffering from anxiety and have shared your worries with someone you trust and lightened your load or maybe you’ve forgiven someone who wronged you in the past and let go of your anger towards them.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: In a career spread, the Four of Pentacles reversed in a positive aspect can show that you be generous to those in your work environment. This may involve giving them your time or assistance, brainstorming and sharing ideas or sharing the credit for successful projects.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Four of Pentacles reversed shows that you are ready to go forward on your spiritual path and will make huge progress in the right direction as you let go of any fear, regret and negativity you were holding onto. This is a great time for you spiritually as you approach things with an open mind and open generous heart.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Four of Pentacles reversed Tarot card can show that you are ready to let go of people, possessions, situations or past issues. You may be releasing toxic people or situations that are no longer healthy for you, shedding old issues or letting go of regrets or fears. You may also be feeling generous and sharing your wealth or possessions by giving to others.

name: Five of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Five of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Five of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Five of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. The Five of Pentacles is not a good omen to get. If you are in a relationship, it can show that you may be struggling with feeling abandoned, ignored or unloved within the relationship.

meaningsUpright.love: The Five of Pentacles is not a good omen to get. If you are in a relationship, it can show that you may be struggling with feeling abandoned, ignored or unloved within the relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Five of Pentacles can show a period of illness or health issues. These health issues may be brought on by other factors in your life.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Five of Pentacles is not a good omen as it can represent unemployment, job losses or going out of business. If you have lost a job or business you may be reliant on social welfare and this may be negatively affecting your confidence or causing you stress.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Five of Pentacles shows that you may be going through a tough time spiritually and feeling like the world is against you or that you have bad luck. Reach out to those around you and accept the help that is available, to get you through this time.

meaningsReversed.love: The Five of Pentacles reversed is a good omen to get. If you are in a relationship, it can show that you are overcoming previous struggles.
meaningsReversed.health: If you have been experiencing health problems or illnesses, the Five of Pentacles reversed can represent diagnosis or treatments. This diagnosis or treatment plan should, if not leading to health improvements right away, at least give you peace of mind that you know what you are dealing with and have a plan to tackle it.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Five of Pentacles reversed is a much better omen as it can represent recovery for a struggling business or a return to employment. If you have been feeling stuck in a career rut due to a lack of opportunities, it would indicate that the struggle is over and opportunities will soon present themselves.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Five of Pentacles reversed shows that you have come through a tough time spiritually and feeling like your luck is improving. You can see light at the end of the tunnel and your faith in the universe’s love for you is being restored.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Five of Pentacles reversed is a good omen especially if you have been going through a tough time as it represents hardship coming to an end, overcoming adversity or a positive change in circumstances. You have struggled through the hard times. When everything seemed hopeless, you held on and now you can see the light at the end of the tunnel!

name: Six of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Six of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Six of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Six of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the Six of Pentacles is a good card to get as it shows that you and your partner will be kind and generous towards each other. Make sure you maintain the balance of give and take in the relationship and it should go from strength to streng….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Six of Pentacles is a good card to get as it shows that you and your partner will be kind and generous towards each other. Make sure you maintain the balance of give and take in the relationship and it should go from strength to strength.
meaningsUpright.health: The Six of Pentacles Tarot card can signify an upswing in your general health and wellness. If you have been dealing with an illness, it can show that you may need to reach out for help and support from others such as healthcare professionals in order to bring about healing.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Six of Pentacles Tarot card is a good card to get as it shows employment and being valued in the workplace. It is a great card to get if you are job hunting or considering changing careers as it can show that you be more successful than you anticipate.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Six of Pentacles advises you may be in a position to share your spiritual knowledge or wisdom with others or you may need others to share with you. Whatever the case, it is worth reaching out to others as you benefit from the experience either way.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Six of Pentacles reversed is not a good card to get as it shows that your relationship lacks balance and that one of you may be dominating the other or abusing your power over them or that one of you has become too dependent or subservient to the other. It can also indicate that one of you may be abusing the other person’s good nature, taking too much and not giving anything back.
meaningsReversed.health: The Six of Pentacles Tarot card reversed can show that a delay in seeking medical advice or not taking advantage of the support or advice available to you could exasperate an existing medical issue or cause poor health.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Six of Pentacles Tarot card reversed is a not good card to get as it can show unemployment, being fired, being under-valued or under-appreciated in the workplace. The Six of Pentacles reversed can signify someone in a powerful position being generous towards you but with an ulterior motive or someone in charge abusing their power.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Six of Pentacles reversed shows one-sided generosity. This may take the form of you giving your time and energy to others constantly but getting nothing in return or becoming subservient to someone because they give you the benefit of their wisdom or making others subservient to you as you know they respect you.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Six of Pentacles reversed Tarot card can represent lack of generosity, meanness or gifts that come with strings or conditions attached. Someone in your life may be showing you generosity but have ulterior motives or they may be in a position to help you but they may be abusing that position or trying to make you subservient to them. If you are in a position of power, it can be an indication that you are using your power for ill means.

name: Seven of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Seven of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Seven of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Seven of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the Seven of Pentacles Tarot card is usually a good card to get as it shows nurturing, perseverance and cultivation which are crucial to making a long term relationship work and thrive. If you and your partner have been putting a lot of eff….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Seven of Pentacles Tarot card is usually a good card to get as it shows nurturing, perseverance and cultivation which are crucial to making a long term relationship work and thrive. If you and your partner have been putting a lot of effort in to your relationship, you should be starting to reap the benefits or will very soon.
meaningsUpright.health: The Seven of Pentacles is generally a good card. If you are looking to improve your health in certain areas, this Minor Arcana card tells you that now would be a good time to evaluate how you can adjust your lifestyle to make these improvements.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Seven of Pentacles Tarot is a good omen to get as it shows that your hard work will start to pay off. Things should be going well on the work front when it appears.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Seven of Pentacles shows that you reap what you sow and that everything you give out, you get back times three. If you have been particularly kind and generous towards others or have been sending love and light out the world, you start to feel these blessings return to you!

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in relationship, the Seven of Pentacles Tarot reversed is generally not a great card to get as it can represent a relationship hitting a rough patch. It can signify getting bogged down in drudgery or a lack of growth within the relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: If you have been experiencing health issues, the Seven of Pentacles reversed can show that these may be the result of poor health habits or behaviour in the past that you are now seeing the result of. If so, you need to start adjusting your lifestyle to correct this behaviour and aid your recovery.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Seven of Pentacles reversed shows either that you are putting too much effort in to your career or not enough. Either way, what you’re doing now is not paying off in the way you would like it to.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, Seven of Pentacles Tarot card reversed can show that you are feeling unhappy or frustrated on a spiritual level. A bit of spiritual reflection would be beneficial right now.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Seven of Pentacles Tarot card reversed can show that you may have been working very hard or putting lots of effort into something for little pay or reward. It can also indicate someone taking on too much, overdoing it or being a workaholic. You may be feeling that nothing you do pays off while others seem to get what they want easily.

name: Eight of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Eight of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Eight of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Eight of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the Eight of Pentacles shows that you are putting a lot of work, dedication and commitment in to your relationship. The effort you’re putting in should be paying off and the relationship moving along nicely.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Eight of Pentacles shows that you are putting a lot of work, dedication and commitment in to your relationship. The effort you’re putting in should be paying off and the relationship moving along nicely.
meaningsUpright.health: The Eight of Pentacles can show that you have been working hard to achieve recovery or fitness. You are paying attention to your health and what your body needs and showing a lot of self-discipline.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: If you are looking for work the Eight of Pentacles Tarot card is a great omen as it signifies a new job. Likewise if you are starting a business it is a welcome card as it shows self-employment, building a business, trade and success.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Eight of Pentacles shows that you are attaining inner wisdom through dedication to your spiritual path. If you have been working to develop your spiritual gifts you should find that the past effort you have put into your spiritual development is starting to pay off as you begin to achieve a new level of mastery of your gifts.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Eight of Pentacles reversed shows that you are not putting the effort in when it comes to your relationship and there may be a lack of commitment or just laziness in terms of making your relationship work. It can also signify letting workaholic tendencies have an adverse effect on your relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: The Eight of Pentacles reversed can swing between two extremes. It can be an indication that you are putting too much focus on your body in a way that is detrimental to your health and life such as starving yourself on an extreme dieting or going overboard with body-building.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Eight of Pentacles Tarot card reversed is not a great omen as it can signify a repetitive or boring job, lack of success/ commitment/ ambition, being an underachiever or on a dead end career path. Things will probably not be going well in a work context when it appears.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Eight of Pentacles reversed shows that you are ignoring your inner wisdom or suppressing your spiritual side. It can signify that you are becoming overly materialistic or mean and it reminds you to refocus on your spiritual side to bring yourself back into balance.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Eight of Pentacles Tarot card reversed can show laziness, idleness, carelessness, lack of effort or poor concentration. Alternatively, it can show focusing on one area to such an extreme that you neglect the other areas of your life such as being mean and materialistic and neglecting your love life or family life or your soul. When this Minor Arcana card appears, it shows that you are not focusing on what you want to achieve or aren’t putting the work in that needed to achieve your goals or that you are spreading yourself too thin which is leading to failure.

name: Nine of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Nine of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Nine of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Nine of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the Nine of Pentacles can show stability and security in a relationship that gives you the freedom, independence and support to pursue your dreams. If you are in business or building your career, your partner will offer you support and enc….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Nine of Pentacles can show stability and security in a relationship that gives you the freedom, independence and support to pursue your dreams. If you are in business or building your career, your partner will offer you support and encouragement.
meaningsUpright.health: The Nine of Pentacles is a positive omen indicating good health. It is a welcome sign if you have been trying to improve your health, lifestyle or fitness or recovering from an illness or injury as it shows success achieved through hard work.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Nine of Pentacles is a good omen indicating success, prosperity, reward and achievement through hard work and professionalism. You should be reaching a point in your career where you can enjoy the status or level of success you have attained.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Nine of Pentacles tells you that the previous effort you have put in to pursuing your spiritual path will pay off leaving you full of confidence. You have gained great insight and wisdom from the journey.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Nine of Pentacles reversed can show a lack of stability and security. It can be a sign that you or your partner are over indulging in things or being spoiled, running up bills and expecting the other to cover the expenses, as it reversed often shows someone who wants all the rewards without putting the work in.
meaningsReversed.health: The Nine of Pentacles reversed can signify over-indulgence, lack of self-control or self-discipline leading to health or fitness issues. If you have been experiencing health issues, consider the changes you could make to your lifestyle, diet or fitness that could assist you in resolving these issues.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Nine of Pentacles reversed is a not a great omen as it can show failure due to lack of effort. You should not expect success if you are not prepared to work for it.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Nine of Pentacles reversed tells you need to show self-discipline. You may be clinging to beliefs that don’t work for you as you lack the confidence or motivation to take an independent spiritual path.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Nine of Pentacles reversed can show a lack of independence, confidence, freedom, security or stability. This Minor Arcana card in a reversed position can signify that someone may be trying to get rewards without putting the work in. You get out of life what you put in so make the effort.

name: Ten of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Ten of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Ten of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Ten of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the Ten of Pentacles is an indication of long-term security and stability. Your relationship will be based on a solid foundation when it appears.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Ten of Pentacles is an indication of long-term security and stability. Your relationship will be based on a solid foundation when it appears.
meaningsUpright.health: The Ten of Pentacles is usually a good card to get as it represents long term stability which suggests a healthy life is possible long term. If you have been having any health issues, it may be worth looking to your family history to check if the issue you are experiencing is inherited.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Ten of Pentacles is a good omen as it can signify a business becoming an empire. It can also indicate that you may go into business with family.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ten of Pentacles can show that you are finding peace and happiness in all areas of your life. Your spiritual journey has led you to this point, where you have manifested that which makes you truly happy and fulfilled in your life.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Ten of Pentacles reversed is not a great omen as it can be an indication of instability, insecurity or divorce. Your relationship may be based on rocky foundations or you may be neglecting your relationship for materialistic pursuits when it appears.
meaningsReversed.health: The Ten of Pentacles reversed can show a sudden unexpected change in terms of health. If this has resulted in a health issue for you, the Ten of Pentacles reversed is a strong indicator that your illness or condition may be genetic or inherited.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Ten of Pentacles reversed is not a good omen as it can signify the breakdown or collapse of a business empire. It can also indicate illegal activity or dodgy business deals.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Ten of Pentacles reversed can show that something may be blocking you from experiencing true fulfilment. This can signify a focus on materialism to the point of cold-heartedness.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Ten of Pentacles reversed can represent rocky foundations, insecurity and instability your life. There is an element of dishonesty associated with this reversed card and a warning to steer clear or illegal or shady activities as they will not go well for you. It is not a great card to get in relation to family as it can signify family feuds, family burdens, neglecting the family, domestic disputes and disputes over a will or inheritance.

name: Page of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Page of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Page of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Page of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the Page of Pentacles can show that there is great loyalty and faithfulness between you and your partner. However, it can show that some of the passion or spark may have gone out of the relationship.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Page of Pentacles can show that there is great loyalty and faithfulness between you and your partner. However, it can show that some of the passion or spark may have gone out of the relationship.
meaningsUpright.health: The Page of Pentacles can show feeling young and healthy no matter what your age. You may be starting out on a new health or fitness regime when it appears.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Page of Pentacles is an excellent omen signifying good news. It shows putting in the groundwork to achieve success, setting goals and deciding what you want and going for it.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Page of Pentacles can show that you are seeking to further your spiritual knowledge. You may be developing your powers of divination or studying the Tarot.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Page of Pentacles reversed tells you to beware as there is potential for disloyalty or unfaithfulness in your relationship. It can be an indication of a lack of maturity or a moody or sullen temperament on either your part or your partner’s.
meaningsReversed.health: The Page of Pentacles reversed can show you may not be feeling great at the moment as it represents an unhealthy lifestyle. If you have been trying to get fit or healthy, it can signify that you are not putting enough effort in.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Page of Pentacles reversed is not a great omen to get as it can signify bad news. It shows that you are not putting in the groundwork to achieve success or that you are lacking goals or follow through.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Page of Pentacles reversed can show that your desire for spiritual knowledge or power may be taking you down an unsavoury path. Your studying of the Tarot or divination may be turning into an obsession or you may be tempted to explore dark magic.

descriptionReversed: In a general context, the Page of Pentacles reversed can be the bearer of bad news in earthly matters. However, often it is an indicator that your present challenges are not due to some outside or unseen force, but rather a consequence of your own behaviour or inaction. It can show that lack of goals or lack of follow through may be holding you back and preventing you from reaching your potential.

name: Knight of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Knight of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Knight of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Knight of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the Knight of Pentacles is a good indicator of a solid, stable and committed relationship. If representing a person in the relationship, this person will be practical, patient, protective and a knight in shining armour.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Knight of Pentacles is a good indicator of a solid, stable and committed relationship. If representing a person in the relationship, this person will be practical, patient, protective and a knight in shining armour.
meaningsUpright.health: If you have been ill or suffering from an injury, the Knight of Pentacles is a welcome card as it shows physical strength and regaining your energy. you get through your current issues and come out of it with a renewed sense of strength.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Knight of Pentacles shows that you are ambitious, driven and focused on reaching your career goals. It can be an indication that you are committed to achieving your long terms ambitions through hard work and perseverance.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Knight of Pentacles is a wish card. It tells you that your wishes will come true through if you persevere.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Knight of Pentacles reversed is a not good indicator as it signifies an unstable relationship that may be lacking commitment or effort. It can signify things becoming a little dull or boring when it appears.
meaningsReversed.health: The Knight of Pentacles reversed shows that one of two extremes is happening with you right now. Either you are being completely lazy and neglecting your fitness and diet or you have gone to the other extreme of being so over-the-top obsessed with your looks, health or fitness that it’s becoming detrimental to your quality of life.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Knight of Pentacles reversed can show that you lack the ambition, drive or focus to reach your career goals. It can be an indication that you are not putting the work in or following through to achieve your long term ambitions.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: In a spiritual context, the Knight of Pentacles reversed tells you that you have to put the effort in if you want your dreams to become a reality. You can’t sit around waiting for things to fall into your lap.

descriptionReversed: In a general Tarot spread, the Knight of Pentacles reversed can represent a lack of common sense, irresponsibility, impracticality, wanting the rewards and recognition without being willing to put the work in and not finishing what you started. This Minor Arcana card reversed signifies that your dreams or wishes will slip through your fingers if you do not start putting in the effort required to make them a reality. It can also represent being environmentally unconscientious and abusive towards or neglectful of animals.

name: Queen of Pentacles
meaningUpright: Queen of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: Queen of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: Queen of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the Queen of Pentacles shows that you be feeling confident and secure in your relationship and deservedly so as you have worked hard to get to this point. You and your partner should be enjoying the finer things in life and may be ind….

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the Queen of Pentacles shows that you be feeling confident and secure in your relationship and deservedly so as you have worked hard to get to this point. You and your partner should be enjoying the finer things in life and may be indulging in a bit of luxury such as a weekend away at a fancy hotel.
meaningsUpright.health: The Queen of Pentacles generally shows good health brought about by good eating, regular exercise and getting plenty of rest and relaxation. If you have been having health issues, it tells you to look to how you are treating yourself and your body.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The Queen of Pentacles is a great omen as she represents a success, being good in business, practical, capable and organised. If representing a person, she is a successful confident woman who is good in business.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The Queen of Pentacles tells you that you need to have belief in yourself, your instincts and your abilities. You should be feeling spiritually fulfilled when it appears.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the Queen of Pentacles reversed can show that you be jealous or insecure in your relationship or that you and your partner may be bored or stuck in a rut. You or your partner may be expressing your insecurity be acting in a possessive or controlling manner.
meaningsReversed.health: The Queen of Pentacles reversed usually represents weight issues (either being over or underweight) or poor health. She can signify that your health is suffering as you are getting so overwhelmed with responsibilities that you are forgetting to do the most basic things for yourself.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The Queen of Pentacles reversed not a great omen as she signifies being bad in business, disorganised, chaotic, out of control or unreliable. If this represents you, you need to pull yourself up by your bootstraps and get to work or you find yourself in serious hot water.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The Queen of Pentacles reversed can show someone putting their natural powers or abilities to negative use or not using the gifts you have been given. If you have been squandering your natural gifts, you need to start making the most of them.

descriptionReversed: In a general Tarot spread, the Queen of Pentacles reversed represents a lack of social status, poverty, failure, dependence and being out of control. This Minor Arcana card tells warns you that if you do not keep your feet on the ground you could lose everything you value. She signifies a lack of common sense or an impractical, dangerous or chaotic approach to life.

name: King of Pentacles
meaningUpright: King of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth
meaningReversed: King of Pentacles reversed themes: work, money, body, earth
description: King of Pentacles upright themes: work, money, body, earth. If you are in a relationship, the King of Pentacles shows that you have reached a very secure, comfortable and stable stage of your relationship. Now is the time to sit back and enjoy all the fruits of your hard work and perseverance.

meaningsUpright.love: If you are in a relationship, the King of Pentacles shows that you have reached a very secure, comfortable and stable stage of your relationship. Now is the time to sit back and enjoy all the fruits of your hard work and perseverance.
meaningsUpright.health: The King of Pentacles is a good health omen usually as he is epitome of health and physical strength and well-being. He shows that you have stability and security in terms of your health so, if you have been concerned about your health, any issues are likely to be resolved easily or may not be as bad as you think.
meaningsUpright.moneyCareer: The King of Pentacles is a great omen indicating successful business or a business empire. He signifies thriving in work matters, achieving a high level of status in your chosen field or reaching your goals.
meaningsUpright.spirituality: The King of Pentacles shows that after many years of focusing on the material aspects of life or financial stability you now have room for something more in your life. All that you need to be secure is in place, now is the time to expand your horizons and connect to the spiritual aspects of yourself.

meaningsReversed.love: If you are in a relationship, the King of Pentacles reversed shows that you have failed to reach the level of security, comfort and stability you wanted from your relationship and this may be causing problems between you and your partner. Jealously, possessiveness, manipulation and controlling behaviour may all be issues in the relationship.
meaningsReversed.health: The King of Pentacles reversed can show insecurity and lack of stability with health. This insecurity may be leading to you excessive anxiety about your health and you may find yourself obsessing about symptoms and illnesses.
meaningsReversed.moneyCareer: The King of Pentacles reversed is not a great omen as it can show unsuccessful businesses or the destruction or collapse of a business empire. He signifies instability in work matters or failure to achieve your goals.
meaningsReversed.spirituality: The King of Pentacles reversed can show that you have become so obsessed with material wealth, possessions or image that you have completely lost touch with your spiritual side and your true essence. You can’t take your possessions with you when you cross over and it’s the love we gave and received in our lives that will matter most in the end, not the car you drove or house big your house was.

descriptionReversed: In a general Tarot spread, the King of Pentacles reversed represents losing your grip on things, not reaching your goals or not seeing things through to the end. This Minor Arcana card reversed can represent losing your social status, failure or lack of success, being impractical, unprincipled, taking ill-advised risks, making hasty decisions or having poor judgement. As a person, the King of Pentacles reversed can represent an older unsuccessful or ungrounded man.
